ReNative

  • Engine RN
  • renative.json
  • Build config object

renative.json API Reference


Following Config reference applies to all renative.json files, including:

./renative.json

./appConfigs/base/renative.json

./appConfigs/\<APP_ID\>/renative.json

\<WORKSPACE\>/renative.json

\<WORKSPACE\>/\<PROJECT_ID\>/renative.json

\<WORKSPACE\>/\<PROJECT_ID\>/appConfigs/base/renative.json

\<WORKSPACE\>/\<PROJECT_ID\>/appConfigs/\<APP_ID\>/renative.json

commonâ€‹

path renative.json/#/common

type object

Common config props used as default props for all available buildSchemes

examples

{
  "common": {
    "author": {
      "name": "Pavel Jacko",
      "email": "Pavel Jacko <pavel.jacko@gmail.com>",
      "url": "https://github.com/pavjacko"
    },
    "license": "MIT",
    "includedPlugins": [
      "*"
    ],
    "includedFonts": [
      "*"
    ],
    "backgroundColor": "#111111",
    "runtime": {
      "welcomeMessage": "Hello ReNative!"
    }
  }
}

common.authorâ€‹

path renative.json/#/common.author

type object

common.backgroundColorâ€‹

path renative.json/#/common.backgroundColor

type string

Defines root view backgroundColor for all platforms in HEX format

examples

{
  "backgroundColor": "#FFFFFF"
}
{
  "backgroundColor": "#222222"
}

common.buildSchemesâ€‹

path renative.json/#/common.buildSchemes

type object

common.buildSchemes.[object].authorâ€‹

path renative.json/#/common.buildSchemes.[object].author

type object

common.buildSchemes.[object].backgroundColorâ€‹

path renative.json/#/common.buildSchemes.[object].backgroundColor

type string

Defines root view backgroundColor for all platforms in HEX format

examples

{
  "backgroundColor": "#FFFFFF"
}
{
  "backgroundColor": "#222222"
}

common.buildSchemes.[object].bundleAssetsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/common.buildSchemes.[object].bundleAssets

type boolean

common.buildSchemes.[object].bundleIsDevâ€‹

path renative.json/#/common.buildSchemes.[object].bundleIsDev

type boolean

common.buildSchemes.[object].deployâ€‹

path renative.json/#/common.buildSchemes.[object].deploy

type object

common.buildSchemes.[object].deploy.typeâ€‹

path renative.json/#/common.buildSchemes.[object].deploy.type

type string

common.buildSchemes.[object].descriptionâ€‹

path renative.json/#/common.buildSchemes.[object].description

type string

General description of your app. This prop will be injected to actual projects where description field is applicable

examples

{
  "description": "This app does awesome things"
}

common.buildSchemes.[object].enabledâ€‹

path renative.json/#/common.buildSchemes.[object].enabled

type boolean

common.buildSchemes.[object].engineâ€‹

path renative.json/#/common.buildSchemes.[object].engine

type string

common.buildSchemes.[object].entryFileâ€‹

path renative.json/#/common.buildSchemes.[object].entryFile

type string

common.buildSchemes.[object].excludedPluginsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/common.buildSchemes.[object].excludedPlugins

type array

Defines an array of all excluded plugins for specific config or buildScheme. only full keys as defined in plugin should be used.

NOTE: excludedPlugins is evaluated after includedPlugins

examples

{
  "excludedPlugins": [
    "*"
  ]
}
{
  "excludedPlugins": [
    "react-native-google-cast",
    "react-navigation-tabs"
  ]
}

common.buildSchemes.[object].extâ€‹

path renative.json/#/common.buildSchemes.[object].ext

type object

Object ysed to extend your renative with custom props. This allows renative json schema to be validated

examples

{
  "ext": {
    "myCustomRenativeProp": "foo"
  }
}

common.buildSchemes.[object].idâ€‹

path renative.json/#/common.buildSchemes.[object].id

type string

common.buildSchemes.[object].ignoreLogsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/common.buildSchemes.[object].ignoreLogs

type boolean

common.buildSchemes.[object].ignoreWarningsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/common.buildSchemes.[object].ignoreWarnings

type boolean

common.buildSchemes.[object].includedFontsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/common.buildSchemes.[object].includedFonts

type array

Array of fonts you want to include in specific app or scheme. Should use exact font file (without the extension) located in ./appConfigs/base/fonts or * to mark all

examples

{
  "includedFonts": [
    "*"
  ]
}
{
  "includedFonts": [
    "TimeBurner",
    "Entypo"
  ]
}

common.buildSchemes.[object].includedPermissionsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/common.buildSchemes.[object].includedPermissions

type array

Allows you to include specific permissions by their KEY defined in permissions object

examples

{
  "includedPermissions": [
    "*"
  ]
}
{
  "includedPermissions": [
    "INTERNET",
    "CAMERA",
    "SYSTEM_ALERT_WINDOW",
    "RECORD_AUDIO",
    "RECORD_VIDEO",
    "READ_EXTERNAL_STORAGE",
    "WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE",
    "ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION",
    "ACCESS_COARSE_LOCATION",
    "VIBRATE",
    "ACCESS_NETWORK_STATE",
    "ACCESS_WIFI_STATE",
    "RECEIVE_BOOT_COMPLETED",
    "WRITE_CONTACTS",
    "READ_CONTACTS"
  ]
}

common.buildSchemes.[object].includedPluginsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/common.buildSchemes.[object].includedPlugins

type array

Defines an array of all included plugins for specific config or buildScheme. only full keys as defined in plugin should be used.

NOTE: includedPlugins is evaluated before excludedPlugins

examples

{
  "includedPlugins": [
    "*"
  ]
}
{
  "includedPlugins": [
    "react-native-google-cast",
    "react-navigation-tabs"
  ]
}

common.buildSchemes.[object].licenseâ€‹

path renative.json/#/common.buildSchemes.[object].license

type string

common.buildSchemes.[object].permissionsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/common.buildSchemes.[object].permissions

type array

DEPRECATED in favor of includedPermissions

common.buildSchemes.[object].runtimeâ€‹

path renative.json/#/common.buildSchemes.[object].runtime

type object

This object will be automatically injected into ./platfromAssets/renative.runtime.json making it possible to inject the values directly to JS source code

examples

{
  "runtime": {
    "someRuntimeProperty": "foo"
  }
}

common.buildSchemes.[object].splashScreenâ€‹

path renative.json/#/common.buildSchemes.[object].splashScreen

type boolean

common.buildSchemes.[object].timestampAssetsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/common.buildSchemes.[object].timestampAssets

type boolean

If set to true generated js (bundle.js) files will be timestamped and named (bundle-12345678.js) every new build. This is useful if you want to enforce invalidate cache agains standard CDN cache policies every new build you deploy

examples

{
  "timestampAssets": "true"
}
{
  "timestampAssets": "false"
}

common.buildSchemes.[object].titleâ€‹

path renative.json/#/common.buildSchemes.[object].title

type string

Title of your app will be used to create title of the binary. ie App title of installed app iOS/Android app or Tab title of the website

examples

{
  "title": "Awesome App"
}

common.buildSchemes.[object].versionedAssetsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/common.buildSchemes.[object].versionedAssets

type boolean

If set to true generated js (bundle.js) files will be timestamped and named (bundle-1.0.0.js) every new version. This is useful if you want to enforce invalidate cache agains standard CDN cache policies every new version you deploy

examples

{
  "versionedAssets": "true"
}
{
  "versionedAssets": "false"
}

common.descriptionâ€‹

path renative.json/#/common.description

type string

General description of your app. This prop will be injected to actual projects where description field is applicable

examples

{
  "description": "This app does awesome things"
}

common.excludedPluginsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/common.excludedPlugins

type array

Defines an array of all excluded plugins for specific config or buildScheme. only full keys as defined in plugin should be used.

NOTE: excludedPlugins is evaluated after includedPlugins

examples

{
  "excludedPlugins": [
    "*"
  ]
}
{
  "excludedPlugins": [
    "react-native-google-cast",
    "react-navigation-tabs"
  ]
}

common.extâ€‹

path renative.json/#/common.ext

type object

Object ysed to extend your renative with custom props. This allows renative json schema to be validated

examples

{
  "ext": {
    "myCustomRenativeProp": "foo"
  }
}

common.idâ€‹

path renative.json/#/common.id

type string

common.ignoreLogsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/common.ignoreLogs

type boolean

common.ignoreWarningsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/common.ignoreWarnings

type boolean

common.includedFontsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/common.includedFonts

type array

Array of fonts you want to include in specific app or scheme. Should use exact font file (without the extension) located in ./appConfigs/base/fonts or * to mark all

examples

{
  "includedFonts": [
    "*"
  ]
}
{
  "includedFonts": [
    "TimeBurner",
    "Entypo"
  ]
}

common.includedPermissionsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/common.includedPermissions

type array

Allows you to include specific permissions by their KEY defined in permissions object

examples

{
  "includedPermissions": [
    "*"
  ]
}
{
  "includedPermissions": [
    "INTERNET",
    "CAMERA",
    "SYSTEM_ALERT_WINDOW",
    "RECORD_AUDIO",
    "RECORD_VIDEO",
    "READ_EXTERNAL_STORAGE",
    "WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE",
    "ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION",
    "ACCESS_COARSE_LOCATION",
    "VIBRATE",
    "ACCESS_NETWORK_STATE",
    "ACCESS_WIFI_STATE",
    "RECEIVE_BOOT_COMPLETED",
    "WRITE_CONTACTS",
    "READ_CONTACTS"
  ]
}

common.includedPluginsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/common.includedPlugins

type array

Defines an array of all included plugins for specific config or buildScheme. only full keys as defined in plugin should be used.

NOTE: includedPlugins is evaluated before excludedPlugins

examples

{
  "includedPlugins": [
    "*"
  ]
}
{
  "includedPlugins": [
    "react-native-google-cast",
    "react-navigation-tabs"
  ]
}

common.licenseâ€‹

path renative.json/#/common.license

type string

common.permissionsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/common.permissions

type array

DEPRECATED in favor of includedPermissions

common.runtimeâ€‹

path renative.json/#/common.runtime

type object

This object will be automatically injected into ./platfromAssets/renative.runtime.json making it possible to inject the values directly to JS source code

examples

{
  "runtime": {
    "someRuntimeProperty": "foo"
  }
}

common.splashScreenâ€‹

path renative.json/#/common.splashScreen

type boolean

common.timestampAssetsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/common.timestampAssets

type boolean

If set to true generated js (bundle.js) files will be timestamped and named (bundle-12345678.js) every new build. This is useful if you want to enforce invalidate cache agains standard CDN cache policies every new build you deploy

examples

{
  "timestampAssets": "true"
}
{
  "timestampAssets": "false"
}

common.titleâ€‹

path renative.json/#/common.title

type string

Title of your app will be used to create title of the binary. ie App title of installed app iOS/Android app or Tab title of the website

examples

{
  "title": "Awesome App"
}

common.versionedAssetsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/common.versionedAssets

type boolean

If set to true generated js (bundle.js) files will be timestamped and named (bundle-1.0.0.js) every new version. This is useful if you want to enforce invalidate cache agains standard CDN cache policies every new version you deploy

examples

{
  "versionedAssets": "true"
}
{
  "versionedAssets": "false"
}

cryptoâ€‹

path renative.json/#/crypto

type object

This prop enables automatic encrypt and decrypt of sensitive information in your project

crypto.decryptâ€‹

path renative.json/#/crypto.decrypt

type object

crypto.decrypt.sourceâ€‹

path renative.json/#/crypto.decrypt.source

type string

Location of encrypted file in your project used as source of decryption into your workspace

examples

{
  "source": "PROJECT_HOME/ci/privateConfigs.enc"
}

crypto.encryptâ€‹

path renative.json/#/crypto.encrypt

type object

crypto.encrypt.destâ€‹

path renative.json/#/crypto.encrypt.dest

type string

Location of encrypted file in your project used as destination of encryption from your workspace

examples

{
  "dest": "PROJECT_HOME/ci/privateConfigs.enc"
}

crypto.optionalâ€‹

path renative.json/#/crypto.optional

type boolean

currentTemplateâ€‹

path renative.json/#/currentTemplate

type string

Currently active template used in this project. this allows you to re-bootstrap whole project by running rnv template apply

examples

{
  "currentTemplate": "renative-template-hello-world"
}

defaultTargetsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/defaultTargets

type object

List of default target simulators and emulators

examples

{
  "defaultTargets": {
    "android": "Nexus_5X_API_26",
    "androidtv": "Android_TV_1080p_API_22",
    "androidwear": "Android_Wear_Round_API_28",
    "ios": "iPhone 8",
    "tvos": "Apple TV 4K",
    "tizen": "T-samsung-5.5-x86",
    "tizenwatch": "W-5.5-circle-x86",
    "tizenmobile": "M-5.5-x86",
    "webos": "emulator"
  }
}

defaultsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/defaults

type object

Default system config for this project

defaults.portsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/defaults.ports

type object

Allows you to assign custom port per each supported platform specific to this project. this is useful if you foten switch between multiple projects and do not want to experience constant port conflicts

examples

{
  "ports": {
    "ios": 8182,
    "android": 8183,
    "androidtv": 8184,
    "tvos": 8185,
    "macos": 8186,
    "web": 8180,
    "tizen": 8187,
    "webos": 8188,
    "androidwear": 8189,
    "tizenwatch": 8190,
    "tizenmobile": 8191,
    "windows": 8192,
    "kaios": 8193,
    "firefoxos": 8194,
    "firefoxtv": 8114
  }
}

defaults.schemesâ€‹

path renative.json/#/defaults.schemes

type object

List of default schemes for each platform. This is useful if you want to avoid specifying -s ... every time your run rnv command. bu default rnv uses -s debug. NOTE: you can only use schemes you defined in buildSchemes

examples

{
  "schemes": {
    "ios": "myCustomScheme",
    "android": "otherCustomScheme"
  }
}

defaults.supportedPlatformsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/defaults.supportedPlatforms

type array

Array list of all supported platforms in current project

examples

{
  "supportedPlatforms": [
    "ios",
    "android",
    "androidtv",
    "web",
    "macos",
    "tvos",
    "androidwear"
  ]
}

defaults.targetsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/defaults.targets

type object

Override of default targets specific to this project

examples

{
  "targets": {
    "ios": "iPhone 8",
    "tvos": "Apple TV 4K"
  }
}

descriptionâ€‹

path renative.json/#/description

type string

enableAnalyticsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/enableAnalytics

type boolean

Enable or disable sending analytics to improve ReNative

examples

{
  "enableAnalytics": "true"
}
{
  "enableAnalytics": "false"
}

enableHookRebuildâ€‹

path renative.json/#/enableHookRebuild

type boolean

If set to true in ./renative.json build hooks will be compiled at each rnv command run. If set to false (default) rebuild will be triggered only if dist folder is missing, -r has been passed or you run rnv hooks run directly making your rnv commands faster

examples

{
  "enableHookRebuild": "true"
}
{
  "enableHookRebuild": "false"
}

enginesâ€‹

path renative.json/#/engines

type object

List of engines available in this project

examples

{
  "engines": {
    "@rnv/engine-rn": "source:rnv",
    "@rnv/engine-rn-web": "source:rnv",
    "@rnv/engine-rn-next": "source:rnv",
    "@rnv/engine-rn-electron": "source:rnv"
  }
}
{
  "engines": {
    "@rnv/engine-rn": "source:rnv",
    "custom-engine": {
      "version": "1.0.0"
    }
  }
}

extâ€‹

path renative.json/#/ext

type object

Object ysed to extend your renative with custom props. This allows renative json schema to be validated

examples

{
  "ext": {
    "myCustomRenativeProp": "foo"
  }
}

extendâ€‹

path renative.json/#/extend

type string

hiddenâ€‹

path renative.json/#/hidden

type boolean

If set to true in ./appConfigs/[APP_ID]/renative.json the APP_ID will be hidden from list of appConfigs -c

examples

{
  "hidden": "true"
}
{
  "hidden": "false"
}

idâ€‹

path renative.json/#/id

type string

ID of the app in ./appConfigs/[APP_ID]/renative.json. MUST match APP_ID name of the folder

examples

{
  "id": "helloworld"
}
{
  "id": "someapp"
}

integrationsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/integrations

type object

isMonorepoâ€‹

path renative.json/#/isMonorepo

type boolean

isWrapperâ€‹

path renative.json/#/isWrapper

type boolean

pathsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/paths

type object

Define custom paths for RNV to look into

paths.appConfigsDirâ€‹

path renative.json/#/paths.appConfigsDir

type string

Custom path to appConfigs. defaults to ./appConfigs

examples

{
  "appConfigsDir": "./appConfigs"
}

paths.platformAssetsDirâ€‹

path renative.json/#/paths.platformAssetsDir

type string

Custom path to platformAssets folder. defaults to ./platformAssets

examples

{
  "platformAssetsDir": "./platformAssets"
}

paths.platformBuildsDirâ€‹

path renative.json/#/paths.platformBuildsDir

type string

Custom path to platformBuilds folder. defaults to ./platformBuilds

examples

{
  "platformBuildsDir": "./platformBuilds"
}

paths.pluginTemplatesâ€‹

path renative.json/#/paths.pluginTemplates

type object

Allows you to define custom plugin template scopes. default scope for all plugins is rnv. this custom scope can then be used by plugin via "source:myCustomScope" value

those will allow you to use direct pointer to preconfigured plugin:

"plugin-name": "source:myCustomScope"

NOTE: by default every plugin you define with scope will also merge any files defined in overrides automatically to your project. To skip file overrides coming from source plugin you need to detach it from the scope:

{
    "plugins": {
        "plugin-name": {
            "source": ""
        }
    }
}

examples

{
  "pluginTemplates": {
    "myCustomScope": {
      "npm": "some-renative-template-package",
      "path": "./pluginTemplates"
    }
  }
}

permissionsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/permissions

type object

Permission definititions which can be used by app configs via includedPermissions and excludedPermissions to customize permissions for each app

examples

{
  "permissions": {
    "ios": {},
    "android": {}
  }
}

permissions.androidâ€‹

path renative.json/#/permissions.android

type object

Android SDK specific permissions

examples

{
  "android": {
    "INTERNET": {
      "key": "android.permission.INTERNET",
      "security": "normal"
    },
    "SYSTEM_ALERT_WINDOW": {
      "key": "android.permission.SYSTEM_ALERT_WINDOW",
      "security": "signature"
    }
  }
}

permissions.iosâ€‹

path renative.json/#/permissions.ios

type object

iOS SDK specific permissions

examples

{
  "ios": {
    "NSAppleMusicUsageDescription": {
      "desc": "Get favorite music"
    },
    "NSBluetoothPeripheralUsageDescription": {
      "desc": "Allow you to use your bluetooth to play music"
    },
    "NSCalendarsUsageDescription": {
      "desc": "Calendar for add events"
    },
    "NSCameraUsageDescription": {
      "desc": "Need camera to scan QR Codes"
    },
    "NSLocationWhenInUseUsageDescription": {
      "desc": "Geolocation tags for photos"
    },
    "NSMicrophoneUsageDescription": {
      "desc": "Need microphone for videos"
    },
    "NSMotionUsageDescription": {
      "desc": "To know when device is moving"
    },
    "NSPhotoLibraryAddUsageDescription": {
      "desc": "Need library to save images"
    },
    "NSPhotoLibraryUsageDescription": {
      "desc": "Allows to upload images from photo library"
    },
    "NSSpeechRecognitionUsageDescription": {
      "desc": "Speech Recognition to run in app commands"
    },
    "NSContactsUsageDescription": {
      "desc": "Get contacts list"
    },
    "NSFaceIDUsageDescription": {
      "desc": "Requires FaceID access to allows you quick and secure access."
    },
    "NSLocationAlwaysUsageDescription": {
      "desc": "Geolocation tags for photos"
    },
    "NSBluetoothAlwaysUsageDescription": {
      "desc": "Allow you to use your bluetooth to play music"
    },
    "NSLocationAlwaysAndWhenInUseUsageDescription": {
      "desc": "Geolocation tags for photos"
    }
  }
}

pipesâ€‹

path renative.json/#/pipes

type array

To avoid rnv building buildHooks/src every time you can specify which specific pipes should trigger recompile of buildHooks

examples

{
  "pipes": [
    "configure:after",
    "start:before",
    "deploy:after",
    "export:before",
    "export:after"
  ]
}

platformsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms

type object

platforms.androidâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.android

type object

platforms.android.AndroidManifestâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.android.AndroidManifest

type object

Allows you to directly manipulate AndroidManifest.xml via json override mechanism

Injects / Overrides values in AndroidManifest.xml file of generated android based project

IMPORTANT: always ensure that your object contains tag and android:name to target correct tag to merge into

examples

{
  "AndroidManifest": {
    "children": [
      {
        "tag": "application",
        "android:name": ".MainApplication",
        "children": [
          {
            "tag": "activity",
            "android:name": "com.ahmedadeltito.photoeditor.PhotoEditorActivity"
          }
        ]
      }
    ]
  }
}
{
  "AndroidManifest": {
    "children": [
      {
        "tag": "application",
        "android:name": ".MainApplication",
        "android:allowBackup": true,
        "android:largeHeap": true,
        "android:usesCleartextTraffic": true,
        "tools:targetApi": 28
      }
    ]
  }
}

platforms.android.aabâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.android.aab

type boolean

platforms.android.app/build.gradleâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.android.app/build.gradle

type object

Overrides values in app/build.gradle file of generated android based project

examples

{
  "app/build.gradle": {
    "apply": [
      "plugin: 'io.fabric'"
    ]
  }
}

platforms.android.applyPluginâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.android.applyPlugin

type array

platforms.android.authorâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.android.author

type object

platforms.android.backgroundColorâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.android.backgroundColor

type string

Defines root view backgroundColor for all platforms in HEX format

examples

{
  "backgroundColor": "#FFFFFF"
}
{
  "backgroundColor": "#222222"
}

platforms.android.build.gradleâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.android.build.gradle

type object

Overrides values in build.gradle file of generated android based project

examples

{
  "build.gradle": {
    "allprojects": {
      "repositories": {
        "maven { url \"https://dl.bintray.com/onfido/maven\" }": true
      }
    }
  }
}

platforms.android.buildSchemesâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.android.buildSchemes

type object

platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].AndroidManifestâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].AndroidManifest

type object

Allows you to directly manipulate AndroidManifest.xml via json override mechanism

Injects / Overrides values in AndroidManifest.xml file of generated android based project

IMPORTANT: always ensure that your object contains tag and android:name to target correct tag to merge into

examples

{
  "AndroidManifest": {
    "children": [
      {
        "tag": "application",
        "android:name": ".MainApplication",
        "children": [
          {
            "tag": "activity",
            "android:name": "com.ahmedadeltito.photoeditor.PhotoEditorActivity"
          }
        ]
      }
    ]
  }
}
{
  "AndroidManifest": {
    "children": [
      {
        "tag": "application",
        "android:name": ".MainApplication",
        "android:allowBackup": true,
        "android:largeHeap": true,
        "android:usesCleartextTraffic": true,
        "tools:targetApi": 28
      }
    ]
  }
}

platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].aabâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].aab

type boolean

platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].app/build.gradleâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].app/build.gradle

type object

Overrides values in app/build.gradle file of generated android based project

examples

{
  "app/build.gradle": {
    "apply": [
      "plugin: 'io.fabric'"
    ]
  }
}

platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].applyPluginâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].applyPlugin

type array

platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].authorâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].author

type object

platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].backgroundColorâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].backgroundColor

type string

Defines root view backgroundColor for all platforms in HEX format

examples

{
  "backgroundColor": "#FFFFFF"
}
{
  "backgroundColor": "#222222"
}

platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].build.gradleâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].build.gradle

type object

Overrides values in build.gradle file of generated android based project

examples

{
  "build.gradle": {
    "allprojects": {
      "repositories": {
        "maven { url \"https://dl.bintray.com/onfido/maven\" }": true
      }
    }
  }
}

platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].bundleAssetsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].bundleAssets

type boolean

platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].bundleIsDevâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].bundleIsDev

type boolean

platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].compileSdkVersionâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].compileSdkVersion

type integer

platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].deployâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].deploy

type object

platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].deploy.typeâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].deploy.type

type string

platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].descriptionâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].description

type string

General description of your app. This prop will be injected to actual projects where description field is applicable

examples

{
  "description": "This app does awesome things"
}

platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].enableAndroidXâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].enableAndroidX

type boolean

platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].enableHermesâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].enableHermes

type boolean

platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].enabledâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].enabled

type boolean

platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].engineâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].engine

type string

platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].entryFileâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].entryFile

type string

platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].excludedFeaturesâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].excludedFeatures

type array

platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].excludedPluginsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].excludedPlugins

type array

Defines an array of all excluded plugins for specific config or buildScheme. only full keys as defined in plugin should be used.

NOTE: excludedPlugins is evaluated after includedPlugins

examples

{
  "excludedPlugins": [
    "*"
  ]
}
{
  "excludedPlugins": [
    "react-native-google-cast",
    "react-navigation-tabs"
  ]
}

platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].extâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].ext

type object

Object ysed to extend your renative with custom props. This allows renative json schema to be validated

examples

{
  "ext": {
    "myCustomRenativeProp": "foo"
  }
}

platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].gradle.propertiesâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].gradle.properties

type object

Overrides values in gradle.properties file of generated android based project

examples

{
  "gradle.properties": {
    "gradle.properties": {
      "android.debug.obsoleteApi": true,
      "debug.keystore": "debug.keystore",
      "org.gradle.daemon": true,
      "org.gradle.parallel": true,
      "org.gradle.configureondemand": true
    }
  }
}

platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].idâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].id

type string

platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].ignoreLogsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].ignoreLogs

type boolean

platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].ignoreWarningsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].ignoreWarnings

type boolean

platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].includedFeaturesâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].includedFeatures

type array

platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].includedFontsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].includedFonts

type array

Array of fonts you want to include in specific app or scheme. Should use exact font file (without the extension) located in ./appConfigs/base/fonts or * to mark all

examples

{
  "includedFonts": [
    "*"
  ]
}
{
  "includedFonts": [
    "TimeBurner",
    "Entypo"
  ]
}

platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].includedPermissionsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].includedPermissions

type array

Allows you to include specific permissions by their KEY defined in permissions object

examples

{
  "includedPermissions": [
    "*"
  ]
}
{
  "includedPermissions": [
    "INTERNET",
    "CAMERA",
    "SYSTEM_ALERT_WINDOW",
    "RECORD_AUDIO",
    "RECORD_VIDEO",
    "READ_EXTERNAL_STORAGE",
    "WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE",
    "ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION",
    "ACCESS_COARSE_LOCATION",
    "VIBRATE",
    "ACCESS_NETWORK_STATE",
    "ACCESS_WIFI_STATE",
    "RECEIVE_BOOT_COMPLETED",
    "WRITE_CONTACTS",
    "READ_CONTACTS"
  ]
}

platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].includedPluginsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].includedPlugins

type array

Defines an array of all included plugins for specific config or buildScheme. only full keys as defined in plugin should be used.

NOTE: includedPlugins is evaluated before excludedPlugins

examples

{
  "includedPlugins": [
    "*"
  ]
}
{
  "includedPlugins": [
    "react-native-google-cast",
    "react-navigation-tabs"
  ]
}

platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].keyAliasâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].keyAlias

type string

platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].keyPasswordâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].keyPassword

type string

platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].licenseâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].license

type string

platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].minSdkVersionâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].minSdkVersion

type integer

platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].multipleAPKsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].multipleAPKs

type boolean

platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].permissionsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].permissions

type array

DEPRECATED in favor of includedPermissions

platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].runtimeâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].runtime

type object

This object will be automatically injected into ./platfromAssets/renative.runtime.json making it possible to inject the values directly to JS source code

examples

{
  "runtime": {
    "someRuntimeProperty": "foo"
  }
}

platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].signingConfigâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].signingConfig

type string

platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].splashScreenâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].splashScreen

type boolean

platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].storeFileâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].storeFile

type string

platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].storePasswordâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].storePassword

type string

platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].targetSdkVersionâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].targetSdkVersion

type integer

platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].timestampAssetsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].timestampAssets

type boolean

If set to true generated js (bundle.js) files will be timestamped and named (bundle-12345678.js) every new build. This is useful if you want to enforce invalidate cache agains standard CDN cache policies every new build you deploy

examples

{
  "timestampAssets": "true"
}
{
  "timestampAssets": "false"
}

platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].titleâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].title

type string

Title of your app will be used to create title of the binary. ie App title of installed app iOS/Android app or Tab title of the website

examples

{
  "title": "Awesome App"
}

platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].universalApkâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].universalApk

type boolean

platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].versionedAssetsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.android.buildSchemes.[object].versionedAssets

type boolean

If set to true generated js (bundle.js) files will be timestamped and named (bundle-1.0.0.js) every new version. This is useful if you want to enforce invalidate cache agains standard CDN cache policies every new version you deploy

examples

{
  "versionedAssets": "true"
}
{
  "versionedAssets": "false"
}

{
  "timestampAssets": "true"

platforms.android.versionedAssetsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.android.versionedAssets

type boolean

If set to true generated js (bundle.js) files will be timestamped and named (bundle-1.0.0.js) every new version. This is useful if you want to enforce invalidate cache agains standard CDN cache policies every new version you deploy

{
  "versionedAssets": "true"
}
{
  "versionedAssets": "false"

platforms.androidtvâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidtv

type object

platforms.androidtv.AndroidManifestâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidtv.AndroidManifest

type object

Allows you to directly manipulate AndroidManifest.xml via json override mechanism

Injects / Overrides values in AndroidManifest.xml file of generated android based project

IMPORTANT: always ensure that your object contains tag and android:name to target correct tag to merge into

examples

{
  "AndroidManifest": {
    "children": [
      {
        "tag": "application",
        "android:name": ".MainApplication",
        "children": [
          {
            "tag": "activity",
            "android:name": "com.ahmedadeltito.photoeditor.PhotoEditorActivity"
          }
        ]
      }
    ]
  }
}
{
  "AndroidManifest": {
    "children": [
      {
        "tag": "application",
        "android:name": ".MainApplication",
        "android:allowBackup": true,
        "android:largeHeap": true,
        "android:usesCleartextTraffic": true,
        "tools:targetApi": 28
      }
    ]
  }
}

platforms.androidtv.aabâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidtv.aab

type boolean

platforms.androidtv.app/build.gradleâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidtv.app/build.gradle

type object

Overrides values in app/build.gradle file of generated android based project

examples

{
  "app/build.gradle": {
    "apply": [
      "plugin: 'io.fabric'"
    ]
  }
}

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidtv.applyPlugin

type array

  "backgroundColor": "#222222"

    "allprojects": {
      "repositories": {

      }
    }
  }

platforms.androidtv.buildSchemesâ€‹

type object

platforms.androidtv.buildSchemes.[object].AndroidManifestâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidtv.buildSchemes.[object].AndroidManifest

type object

Allows you to directly manipulate AndroidManifest.xml via json override mechanism

Injects / Overrides values in AndroidManifest.xml file of generated android based project

IMPORTANT: always ensure that your object contains tag and android:name to target correct tag to merge into

examples

{
  "AndroidManifest": {
    "children": [
      {
        "tag": "application",
        "android:name": ".MainApplication",
        "children": [
          {
            "tag": "activity",
            "android:name": "com.ahmedadeltito.photoeditor.PhotoEditorActivity"
          }
        ]
      }
    ]
  }
}
{
  "AndroidManifest": {
    "children": [
      {
        "tag": "application",
        "android:name": ".MainApplication",
        "android:allowBackup": true,
        "android:largeHeap": true,
        "android:usesCleartextTraffic": true,
        "tools:targetApi": 28
      }
    ]
  }
}

examples

{
  "excludedPlugins": [
    "*"
  ]
}
{
  "excludedPlugins": [
    "react-native-google-cast",
    "react-navigation-tabs"
  ]
}

platforms.androidtv.buildSchemes.[object].extâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidtv.buildSchemes.[object].ext

type object

Object ysed to extend your renative with custom props. This allows renative json schema to be validated

examples

{
  "ext": {
    "myCustomRenativeProp": "foo"
  }
}

platforms.androidtv.buildSchemes.[object].gradle.propertiesâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidtv.buildSchemes.[object].gradle.properties

type object

Overrides values in gradle.properties file of generated android based project

examples

{
  "gradle.properties": {
    "gradle.properties": {
      "android.debug.obsoleteApi": true,
      "debug.keystore": "debug.keystore",
      "org.gradle.daemon": true,
      "org.gradle.parallel": true,
      "org.gradle.configureondemand": true
    }
  }
}

platforms.androidtv.buildSchemes.[object].idâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidtv.buildSchemes.[object].id

type string

platforms.androidtv.buildSchemes.[object].ignoreLogsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidtv.buildSchemes.[object].ignoreLogs

type boolean

platforms.androidtv.buildSchemes.[object].ignoreWarningsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidtv.buildSchemes.[object].ignoreWarnings

type boolean

platforms.androidtv.buildSchemes.[object].includedFeaturesâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidtv.buildSchemes.[object].includedFeatures

type array

platforms.androidtv.buildSchemes.[object].includedFontsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidtv.buildSchemes.[object].includedFonts

type array

Array of fonts you want to include in specific app or scheme. Should use exact font file (without the extension) located in ./appConfigs/base/fonts or * to mark all

examples

{
  "includedFonts": [
    "*"
  ]
}
{
  "includedFonts": [
    "TimeBurner",
    "Entypo"
  ]
}

platforms.androidtv.buildSchemes.[object].includedPermissionsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidtv.buildSchemes.[object].includedPermissions

type array

Allows you to include specific permissions by their KEY defined in permissions object

examples

{
  "includedPermissions": [
    "*"
  ]
}
{
  "includedPermissions": [
    "INTERNET",
    "CAMERA",
    "SYSTEM_ALERT_WINDOW",
    "RECORD_AUDIO",
    "RECORD_VIDEO",
    "READ_EXTERNAL_STORAGE",
    "WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE",
    "ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION",
    "ACCESS_COARSE_LOCATION",
    "VIBRATE",
    "ACCESS_NETWORK_STATE",
    "ACCESS_WIFI_STATE",
    "RECEIVE_BOOT_COMPLETED",
    "WRITE_CONTACTS",
    "READ_CONTACTS"
  ]
}

platforms.androidtv.buildSchemes.[object].includedPluginsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidtv.buildSchemes.[object].includedPlugins

type array

Defines an array of all included plugins for specific config or buildScheme. only full keys as defined in plugin should be used.

NOTE: includedPlugins is evaluated before excludedPlugins

examples

{
  "includedPlugins": [
    "*"
  ]
}
{
  "includedPlugins": [
    "react-native-google-cast",
    "react-navigation-tabs"
  ]
}

platforms.androidtv.buildSchemes.[object].keyAliasâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidtv.buildSchemes.[object].keyAlias

type string

platforms.androidtv.buildSchemes.[object].keyPasswordâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidtv.buildSchemes.[object].keyPassword

type string

platforms.androidtv.buildSchemes.[object].licenseâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidtv.buildSchemes.[object].license

type string

platforms.androidtv.buildSchemes.[object].minSdkVersionâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidtv.buildSchemes.[object].minSdkVersion

type integer

platforms.androidtv.buildSchemes.[object].multipleAPKsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidtv.buildSchemes.[object].multipleAPKs

type boolean

platforms.androidtv.buildSchemes.[object].permissionsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidtv.buildSchemes.[object].permissions

type array

DEPRECATED in favor of includedPermissions

platforms.androidtv.buildSchemes.[object].runtimeâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidtv.buildSchemes.[object].runtime

type object

This object will be automatically injected into ./platfromAssets/renative.runtime.json making it possible to inject the values directly to JS source code

examples

{
  "runtime": {
    "someRuntimeProperty": "foo"
  }
}

platforms.androidtv.buildSchemes.[object].signingConfigâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidtv.buildSchemes.[object].signingConfig

type string

platforms.androidtv.buildSchemes.[object].splashScreenâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidtv.buildSchemes.[object].splashScreen

type boolean

platforms.androidtv.buildSchemes.[object].storeFileâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidtv.buildSchemes.[object].storeFile

type string

platforms.androidtv.buildSchemes.[object].storePasswordâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidtv.buildSchemes.[object].storePassword

type string

platforms.androidtv.buildSchemes.[object].targetSdkVersionâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidtv.buildSchemes.[object].targetSdkVersion

type integer

platforms.androidtv.buildSchemes.[object].timestampAssetsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidtv.buildSchemes.[object].timestampAssets

type boolean

If set to true generated js (bundle.js) files will be timestamped and named (bundle-12345678.js) every new build. This is useful if you want to enforce invalidate cache agains standard CDN cache policies every new build you deploy

examples

{
  "timestampAssets": "true"
}
{
  "timestampAssets": "false"
}

platforms.androidtv.buildSchemes.[object].titleâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidtv.buildSchemes.[object].title

type string

Title of your app will be used to create title of the binary. ie App title of installed app iOS/Android app or Tab title of the website

examples

{
  "title": "Awesome App"
}

platforms.androidtv.buildSchemes.[object].universalApkâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidtv.buildSchemes.[object].universalApk

type boolean

platforms.androidtv.buildSchemes.[object].versionedAssetsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidtv.buildSchemes.[object].versionedAssets

type boolean

If set to true generated js (bundle.js) files will be timestamped and named (bundle-1.0.0.js) every new version. This is useful if you want to enforce invalidate cache agains standard CDN cache policies every new version you deploy

examples

{
  "versionedAssets": "true"
}
{
  "versionedAssets": "false"
}

platforms.androidtv.bundleAssetsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidtv.bundleAssets

type boolean

type object

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidtv.deploy.type

type string

platforms.androidtv.descriptionâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidtv.description

type string

General description of your app. This prop will be injected to actual projects where description field is applicable

examples

{
  "description": "This app does awesome things"
}

platforms.androidtv.excludedPluginsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidtv.excludedPlugins

type array

Defines an array of all excluded plugins for specific config or buildScheme. only full keys as defined in plugin should be used.

NOTE: excludedPlugins is evaluated after includedPlugins

examples

{
  "excludedPlugins": [
    "*"
  ]
}
{
  "excludedPlugins": [
    "react-native-google-cast",
    "react-navigation-tabs"
  ]
}

platforms.androidtv.versionedAssetsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidtv.versionedAssets

platforms.androidwearâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidwear

type object

platforms.androidwear.AndroidManifestâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidwear.AndroidManifest

type object

Allows you to directly manipulate AndroidManifest.xml via json override mechanism

Injects / Overrides values in AndroidManifest.xml file of generated android based project

IMPORTANT: always ensure that your object contains tag and android:name to target correct tag to merge into

examples

{
  "AndroidManifest": {
    "children": [
      {
        "tag": "application",
        "android:name": ".MainApplication",
        "children": [
          {
            "tag": "activity",
            "android:name": "com.ahmedadeltito.photoeditor.PhotoEditorActivity"
          }
        ]
      }
    ]
  }
}
{
  "AndroidManifest": {
    "children": [
      {
        "tag": "application",
        "android:name": ".MainApplication",
        "android:allowBackup": true,
        "android:largeHeap": true,
        "android:usesCleartextTraffic": true,
        "tools:targetApi": 28
      }
    ]
  }
}

platforms.androidwear.aabâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidwear.aab

type boolean

platforms.androidwear.app/build.gradleâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidwear.app/build.gradle

type object

Overrides values in app/build.gradle file of generated android based project

examples

{
  "app/build.gradle": {
    "apply": [
      "plugin: 'io.fabric'"
    ]
  }
}

platforms.androidwear.applyPluginâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidwear.applyPlugin

type array

platforms.androidwear.authorâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidwear.author

type object

platforms.androidwear.backgroundColorâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidwear.backgroundColor

type string

Defines root view backgroundColor for all platforms in HEX format

examples

{
  "backgroundColor": "#FFFFFF"
}
{
  "backgroundColor": "#222222"
}

platforms.androidwear.build.gradleâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidwear.build.gradle

type object

Overrides values in build.gradle file of generated android based project

examples

{
  "build.gradle": {
    "allprojects": {
      "repositories": {
        "maven { url \"https://dl.bintray.com/onfido/maven\" }": true
      }
    }
  }
}

platforms.androidwear.buildSchemesâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidwear.buildSchemes

type object

platforms.androidwear.buildSchemes.[object].AndroidManifestâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidwear.buildSchemes.[object].AndroidManifest

type object

Allows you to directly manipulate AndroidManifest.xml via json override mechanism

Injects / Overrides values in AndroidManifest.xml file of generated android based project

IMPORTANT: always ensure that your object contains tag and android:name to target correct tag to merge into

examples

{
  "AndroidManifest": {
    "children": [
      {
        "tag": "application",
        "android:name": ".MainApplication",
        "children": [
          {
            "tag": "activity",
            "android:name": "com.ahmedadeltito.photoeditor.PhotoEditorActivity"
          }
        ]
      }
    ]
  }
}
{
  "AndroidManifest": {
    "children": [
      {
        "tag": "application",
        "android:name": ".MainApplication",
        "android:allowBackup": true,
        "android:largeHeap": true,
        "android:usesCleartextTraffic": true,
        "tools:targetApi": 28
      }
    ]
  }
}

platforms.androidwear.buildSchemes.[object].keyPasswordâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidwear.buildSchemes.[object].keyPassword

type string

platforms.androidwear.buildSchemes.[object].licenseâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidwear.buildSchemes.[object].license

type string

platforms.androidwear.buildSchemes.[object].minSdkVersionâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidwear.buildSchemes.[object].minSdkVersion

type integer

platforms.androidwear.buildSchemes.[object].multipleAPKsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidwear.buildSchemes.[object].multipleAPKs

type boolean

platforms.androidwear.buildSchemes.[object].permissionsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidwear.buildSchemes.[object].permissions

type array

DEPRECATED in favor of includedPermissions

platforms.androidwear.buildSchemes.[object].runtimeâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidwear.buildSchemes.[object].runtime

type object

This object will be automatically injected into ./platfromAssets/renative.runtime.json making it possible to inject the values directly to JS source code

examples

{
  "runtime": {
    "someRuntimeProperty": "foo"
  }
}

platforms.androidwear.buildSchemes.[object].signingConfigâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidwear.buildSchemes.[object].signingConfig

type string

platforms.androidwear.buildSchemes.[object].splashScreenâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidwear.buildSchemes.[object].splashScreen

type boolean

platforms.androidwear.buildSchemes.[object].storeFileâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidwear.buildSchemes.[object].storeFile

type string

platforms.androidwear.buildSchemes.[object].storePasswordâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidwear.buildSchemes.[object].storePassword

type string

platforms.androidwear.buildSchemes.[object].targetSdkVersionâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidwear.buildSchemes.[object].targetSdkVersion

type integer

platforms.androidwear.buildSchemes.[object].timestampAssetsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidwear.buildSchemes.[object].timestampAssets

type boolean

If set to true generated js (bundle.js) files will be timestamped and named (bundle-12345678.js) every new build. This is useful if you want to enforce invalidate cache agains standard CDN cache policies every new build you deploy

examples

{
  "timestampAssets": "true"
}
{
  "timestampAssets": "false"
}

platforms.androidwear.buildSchemes.[object].titleâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidwear.buildSchemes.[object].title

type string

Title of your app will be used to create title of the binary. ie App title of installed app iOS/Android app or Tab title of the website

examples

{
  "title": "Awesome App"
}

platforms.androidwear.buildSchemes.[object].universalApkâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidwear.buildSchemes.[object].universalApk

type boolean

platforms.androidwear.buildSchemes.[object].versionedAssetsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidwear.buildSchemes.[object].versionedAssets

type boolean

If set to true generated js (bundle.js) files will be timestamped and named (bundle-1.0.0.js) every new version. This is useful if you want to enforce invalidate cache agains standard CDN cache policies every new version you deploy

examples

{
  "versionedAssets": "true"
}
{
  "versionedAssets": "false"
}

platforms.androidwear.bundleAssetsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidwear.bundleAssets

type boolean

platforms.androidwear.bundleIsDevâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidwear.bundleIsDev

type boolean

platforms.androidwear.compileSdkVersionâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidwear.compileSdkVersion

type integer

platforms.androidwear.deployâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidwear.deploy

type object

platforms.androidwear.deploy.typeâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidwear.deploy.type

type string

platforms.androidwear.descriptionâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidwear.description

type string

General description of your app. This prop will be injected to actual projects where description field is applicable

examples

{
  "description": "This app does awesome things"
}

platforms.androidwear.enableAndroidXâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidwear.enableAndroidX

type boolean

platforms.androidwear.enableHermesâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidwear.enableHermes

type boolean

platforms.androidwear.engineâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidwear.engine

type string

platforms.androidwear.entryFileâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidwear.entryFile

type string

platforms.androidwear.excludedFeaturesâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidwear.excludedFeatures

type array

platforms.androidwear.excludedPluginsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidwear.excludedPlugins

type array

Defines an array of all excluded plugins for specific config or buildScheme. only full keys as defined in plugin should be used.

NOTE: excludedPlugins is evaluated after includedPlugins

examples

{
  "excludedPlugins": [
    "*"
  ]
}
{
  "excludedPlugins": [
    "react-native-google-cast",
    "react-navigation-tabs"
  ]
}

platforms.androidwear.extâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidwear.ext

type object

Object ysed to extend your renative with custom props. This allows renative json schema to be validated

examples

{
  "ext": {
    "myCustomRenativeProp": "foo"
  }
}

platforms.androidwear.gradle.propertiesâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidwear.gradle.properties

type object

Overrides values in gradle.properties file of generated android based project

examples

{
  "gradle.properties": {
    "gradle.properties": {
      "android.debug.obsoleteApi": true,
      "debug.keystore": "debug.keystore",
      "org.gradle.daemon": true,
      "org.gradle.parallel": true,
      "org.gradle.configureondemand": true
    }
  }
}

platforms.androidwear.idâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidwear.id

type string

platforms.androidwear.ignoreLogsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidwear.ignoreLogs

type boolean

platforms.androidwear.ignoreWarningsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidwear.ignoreWarnings

type boolean

platforms.androidwear.includedFeaturesâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidwear.includedFeatures

type array

platforms.androidwear.includedFontsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidwear.includedFonts

type array

Array of fonts you want to include in specific app or scheme. Should use exact font file (without the extension) located in ./appConfigs/base/fonts or * to mark all

examples

{
  "includedFonts": [
    "*"
  ]
}
{
  "includedFonts": [
    "TimeBurner",
    "Entypo"
  ]
}

platforms.androidwear.includedPermissionsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidwear.includedPermissions

type array

Allows you to include specific permissions by their KEY defined in permissions object

examples

{
  "includedPermissions": [
    "*"
  ]
}
{
  "includedPermissions": [
    "INTERNET",
    "CAMERA",
    "SYSTEM_ALERT_WINDOW",
    "RECORD_AUDIO",
    "RECORD_VIDEO",
    "READ_EXTERNAL_STORAGE",
    "WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE",
    "ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION",
    "ACCESS_COARSE_LOCATION",
    "VIBRATE",
    "ACCESS_NETWORK_STATE",
    "ACCESS_WIFI_STATE",
    "RECEIVE_BOOT_COMPLETED",
    "WRITE_CONTACTS",
    "READ_CONTACTS"
  ]
}

platforms.androidwear.includedPluginsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidwear.includedPlugins

type array

Defines an array of all included plugins for specific config or buildScheme. only full keys as defined in plugin should be used.

NOTE: includedPlugins is evaluated before excludedPlugins

examples

{
  "includedPlugins": [
    "*"
  ]
}
{
  "includedPlugins": [
    "react-native-google-cast",
    "react-navigation-tabs"
  ]
}

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidwear.keyAlias

platforms.androidwear.timestampAssetsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.androidwear.timestampAssets

type boolean

If set to true generated js (bundle.js) files will be timestamped and named (bundle-12345678.js) every new build. This is useful if you want to enforce invalidate cache agains standard CDN cache policies every new build you deploy

examples

{
  "timestampAssets": "true"
}
{
  "timestampAssets": "false"
}

platforms.chromecast.backgroundColorâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.chromecast.backgroundColor

type string

Defines root view backgroundColor for all platforms in HEX format

examples

{
  "backgroundColor": "#FFFFFF"
}
{
  "backgroundColor": "#222222"
}

type object

platforms.chromecast.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfig.customScriptsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.chromecast.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfig.customScripts

type array

platforms.chromecast.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfig.devServerHostâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.chromecast.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfig.devServerHost

type string

platforms.chromecast.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfig.extendâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.chromecast.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfig.extend

type object

Allows you to directly extend/override webpack config of your current platform

examples

{
  "extend": {
    "devtool": "source-map"
  }
}
{
  "extend": {
    "module": {
      "rules": [
        {
          "test": {},
          "use": [
            "source-map-loader"
          ],
          "enforce": "pre"
        }
      ]
    }
  }
}

platforms.chromecast.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfig.metaTagsâ€‹

  "versionedAssets": "false"
}

platforms.chromecast.webpackConfigâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.chromecast.webpackConfig

type object

platforms.chromecast.webpackConfig.customScriptsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.chromecast.webpackConfig.customScripts

type array

platforms.chromecast.webpackConfig.devServerHostâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.chromecast.webpackConfig.devServerHost

type string

platforms.chromecast.webpackConfig.extendâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.chromecast.webpackConfig.extend

type object

Allows you to directly extend/override webpack config of your current platform

examples

{
  "extend": {
    "devtool": "source-map"
  }
}
{
  "extend": {
    "module": {
      "rules": [
        {
          "test": {},
          "use": [
            "source-map-loader"
          ],
          "enforce": "pre"
        }
      ]
    }
  }
}

platforms.chromecast.webpackConfig.metaTagsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.chromecast.webpackConfig.metaTags

type object

platforms.firefoxosâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.firefoxos.author

type object

platforms.firefoxos.backgroundColorâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.firefoxos.backgroundColor

type string

Defines root view backgroundColor for all platforms in HEX format

examples

{
  "backgroundColor": "#FFFFFF"
}
{
  "backgroundColor": "#222222"
}

platforms.firefoxos.buildSchemesâ€‹

type object

type object

platforms.firefoxos.buildSchemes.[object].backgroundColorâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.firefoxos.buildSchemes.[object].backgroundColor

type string

Defines root view backgroundColor for all platforms in HEX format

examples

{
  "backgroundColor": "#FFFFFF"
}
{
  "backgroundColor": "#222222"
}

platforms.firefoxos.buildSchemes.[object].bundleAssetsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.firefoxos.buildSchemes.[object].bundleAssets

type boolean

platforms.firefoxos.buildSchemes.[object].bundleIsDevâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.firefoxos.buildSchemes.[object].bundleIsDev

type boolean

path renative.json/#/platforms.firefoxos.buildSchemes.[object].deploy

type object

platforms.firefoxos.buildSchemes.[object].deploy.typeâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.firefoxos.buildSchemes.[object].deploy.type

type string

platforms.firefoxos.buildSchemes.[object].descriptionâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.firefoxos.buildSchemes.[object].description

type string

General description of your app. This prop will be injected to actual projects where description field is applicable

examples

{
  "description": "This app does awesome things"
}

platforms.firefoxos.buildSchemes.[object].devServerHostâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.firefoxos.buildSchemes.[object].devServerHost

type string

platforms.firefoxos.buildSchemes.[object].enabledâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.firefoxos.buildSchemes.[object].enabled

type boolean

platforms.firefoxos.buildSchemes.[object].engineâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.firefoxos.buildSchemes.[object].engine

type string

platforms.firefoxos.buildSchemes.[object].entryFileâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.firefoxos.buildSchemes.[object].entryFile

type string

platforms.firefoxos.buildSchemes.[object].excludedPluginsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.firefoxos.buildSchemes.[object].excludedPlugins

type array

Defines an array of all excluded plugins for specific config or buildScheme. only full keys as defined in plugin should be used.

NOTE: excludedPlugins is evaluated after includedPlugins

examples

{
  "excludedPlugins": [
    "*"
  ]
}
{
  "excludedPlugins": [
    "react-native-google-cast",
    "react-navigation-tabs"
  ]
}

platforms.firefoxos.buildSchemes.[object].extâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.firefoxos.buildSchemes.[object].ext

type object

Object ysed to extend your renative with custom props. This allows renative json schema to be validated

examples

{
  "ext": {
    "myCustomRenativeProp": "foo"
  }
}

platforms.firefoxos.buildSchemes.[object].idâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.firefoxos.buildSchemes.[object].id

type string

platforms.firefoxos.buildSchemes.[object].ignoreLogsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.firefoxos.buildSchemes.[object].ignoreLogs

type boolean

platforms.firefoxos.buildSchemes.[object].ignoreWarningsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.firefoxos.buildSchemes.[object].ignoreWarnings

type boolean

platforms.firefoxos.buildSchemes.[object].includedFontsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.firefoxos.buildSchemes.[object].includedFonts

type array

Array of fonts you want to include in specific app or scheme. Should use exact font file (without the extension) located in ./appConfigs/base/fonts or * to mark all

examples

{
  "includedFonts": [
    "*"
  ]
}
{
  "includedFonts": [
    "TimeBurner",
    "Entypo"
  ]
}

platforms.firefoxos.buildSchemes.[object].includedPermissionsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.firefoxos.buildSchemes.[object].includedPermissions

type array

Allows you to include specific permissions by their KEY defined in permissions object

examples

{
  "includedPermissions": [
    "*"
  ]
}
{
  "includedPermissions": [
    "INTERNET",
    "CAMERA",
    "SYSTEM_ALERT_WINDOW",
    "RECORD_AUDIO",
    "RECORD_VIDEO",
    "READ_EXTERNAL_STORAGE",
    "WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE",
    "ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION",
    "ACCESS_COARSE_LOCATION",
    "VIBRATE",
    "ACCESS_NETWORK_STATE",
    "ACCESS_WIFI_STATE",
    "RECEIVE_BOOT_COMPLETED",
    "WRITE_CONTACTS",
    "READ_CONTACTS"
  ]
}

platforms.firefoxos.buildSchemes.[object].includedPluginsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.firefoxos.buildSchemes.[object].includedPlugins

type array

Defines an array of all included plugins for specific config or buildScheme. only full keys as defined in plugin should be used.

NOTE: includedPlugins is evaluated before excludedPlugins

examples

{
  "includedPlugins": [
    "*"
  ]
}
{
  "includedPlugins": [
    "react-native-google-cast",
    "react-navigation-tabs"
  ]
}

platforms.firefoxos.buildSchemes.[object].licenseâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.firefoxos.buildSchemes.[object].license

type string

platforms.firefoxos.buildSchemes.[object].permissionsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.firefoxos.buildSchemes.[object].permissions

type array

DEPRECATED in favor of includedPermissions

platforms.firefoxos.buildSchemes.[object].runtimeâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.firefoxos.buildSchemes.[object].runtime

type object

This object will be automatically injected into ./platfromAssets/renative.runtime.json making it possible to inject the values directly to JS source code

examples

{
  "runtime": {
    "someRuntimeProperty": "foo"
  }
}

platforms.firefoxos.buildSchemes.[object].splashScreenâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.firefoxos.buildSchemes.[object].splashScreen

type boolean

platforms.firefoxos.buildSchemes.[object].timestampAssetsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.firefoxos.buildSchemes.[object].timestampAssets

type boolean

If set to true generated js (bundle.js) files will be timestamped and named (bundle-12345678.js) every new build. This is useful if you want to enforce invalidate cache agains standard CDN cache policies every new build you deploy

examples

{
  "timestampAssets": "true"
}
{
  "timestampAssets": "false"
}

platforms.firefoxos.buildSchemes.[object].titleâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.firefoxos.buildSchemes.[object].title

type string

Title of your app will be used to create title of the binary. ie App title of installed app iOS/Android app or Tab title of the website

examples

{
  "title": "Awesome App"
}

platforms.firefoxos.buildSchemes.[object].versionedAssetsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.firefoxos.buildSchemes.[object].versionedAssets

type boolean

If set to true generated js (bundle.js) files will be timestamped and named (bundle-1.0.0.js) every new version. This is useful if you want to enforce invalidate cache agains standard CDN cache policies every new version you deploy

examples

{
  "versionedAssets": "true"
}
{
  "versionedAssets": "false"
}

platforms.firefoxos.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfigâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.firefoxos.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfig

type object

type array

type string

platforms.firefoxos.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfig.extendâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.firefoxos.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfig.extend

type object

Allows you to directly extend/override webpack config of your current platform

examples

{
  "extend": {
    "devtool": "source-map"
  }
}
{
  "extend": {
    "module": {
      "rules": [
        {
          "test": {},
          "use": [
            "source-map-loader"
          ],
          "enforce": "pre"
        }
      ]
    }
  }
}

path renative.json/#/platforms.firefoxtv.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfig.devServerHost

type string

platforms.firefoxtv.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfig.extendâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.firefoxtv.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfig.extend

type object

Allows you to directly extend/override webpack config of your current platform

examples

{
  "extend": {
    "devtool": "source-map"
  }
}
{
  "extend": {
    "module": {
      "rules": [
        {
          "test": {},
          "use": [
            "source-map-loader"
          ],
          "enforce": "pre"
        }
      ]
    }
  }
}

platforms.firefoxtv.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfig.metaTagsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.firefoxtv.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfig.metaTags

type object

platforms.firefoxtv.bundleAssetsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.firefoxtv.bundleAssets

type boolean

platforms.firefoxtv.bundleIsDevâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.firefoxtv.bundleIsDev

type boolean

platforms.firefoxtv.deployâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.firefoxtv.deploy

type object

platforms.firefoxtv.deploy.typeâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.firefoxtv.deploy.type

type string

platforms.firefoxtv.descriptionâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.firefoxtv.description

type string

General description of your app. This prop will be injected to actual projects where description field is applicable

examples

{
  "description": "This app does awesome things"
}

platforms.firefoxtv.devServerHostâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.firefoxtv.devServerHost

type string

platforms.firefoxtv.engineâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.firefoxtv.engine

type string

platforms.firefoxtv.entryFileâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.firefoxtv.entryFile

type string

platforms.firefoxtv.excludedPluginsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.firefoxtv.excludedPlugins

type array

Defines an array of all excluded plugins for specific config or buildScheme. only full keys as defined in plugin should be used.

NOTE: excludedPlugins is evaluated after includedPlugins

examples

{
  "excludedPlugins": [
    "*"
  ]
}
{
  "excludedPlugins": [
    "react-native-google-cast",
    "react-navigation-tabs"
  ]
}

platforms.firefoxtv.extâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.firefoxtv.ext

type object

Object ysed to extend your renative with custom props. This allows renative json schema to be validated

examples

{
  "ext": {
    "myCustomRenativeProp": "foo"
  }
}

platforms.firefoxtv.idâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.firefoxtv.id

type string

platforms.firefoxtv.ignoreLogsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.firefoxtv.ignoreLogs

type boolean

platforms.firefoxtv.ignoreWarningsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.firefoxtv.ignoreWarnings

type boolean

platforms.firefoxtv.includedFontsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.firefoxtv.includedFonts

type array

Array of fonts you want to include in specific app or scheme. Should use exact font file (without the extension) located in ./appConfigs/base/fonts or * to mark all

examples

{
  "includedFonts": [
    "*"
  ]
}
{
  "includedFonts": [
    "TimeBurner",
    "Entypo"
  ]
}

platforms.firefoxtv.includedPermissionsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.firefoxtv.includedPermissions

type array

Allows you to include specific permissions by their KEY defined in permissions object

examples

{
  "includedPermissions": [
    "*"
  ]
}
{
  "includedPermissions": [
    "INTERNET",
    "CAMERA",
    "SYSTEM_ALERT_WINDOW",
    "RECORD_AUDIO",
    "RECORD_VIDEO",
    "READ_EXTERNAL_STORAGE",
    "WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE",
    "ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION",
    "ACCESS_COARSE_LOCATION",
    "VIBRATE",
    "ACCESS_NETWORK_STATE",
    "ACCESS_WIFI_STATE",
    "RECEIVE_BOOT_COMPLETED",
    "WRITE_CONTACTS",
    "READ_CONTACTS"
  ]
}

platforms.firefoxtv.includedPluginsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.firefoxtv.includedPlugins

type array

Defines an array of all included plugins for specific config or buildScheme. only full keys as defined in plugin should be used.

NOTE: includedPlugins is evaluated before excludedPlugins

examples

{
  "includedPlugins": [
    "*"
  ]
}
{
  "includedPlugins": [
    "react-native-google-cast",
    "react-navigation-tabs"
  ]
}

platforms.firefoxtv.licenseâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.firefoxtv.license

type string

platforms.firefoxtv.permissionsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.firefoxtv.permissions

type array

DEPRECATED in favor of includedPermissions

platforms.firefoxtv.runtimeâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.firefoxtv.runtime

type object

This object will be automatically injected into ./platfromAssets/renative.runtime.json making it possible to inject the values directly to JS source code

examples

{
  "runtime": {
    "someRuntimeProperty": "foo"
  }
}

platforms.firefoxtv.splashScreenâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.firefoxtv.splashScreen

type boolean

platforms.firefoxtv.timestampAssetsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.firefoxtv.timestampAssets

type boolean

If set to true generated js (bundle.js) files will be timestamped and named (bundle-12345678.js) every new build. This is useful if you want to enforce invalidate cache agains standard CDN cache policies every new build you deploy

examples

{
  "timestampAssets": "true"
}
{
  "timestampAssets": "false"
}

platforms.firefoxtv.titleâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.firefoxtv.title

type string

Title of your app will be used to create title of the binary. ie App title of installed app iOS/Android app or Tab title of the website

examples

{
  "title": "Awesome App"
}

platforms.firefoxtv.versionedAssetsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.firefoxtv.versionedAssets

type boolean

If set to true generated js (bundle.js) files will be timestamped and named (bundle-1.0.0.js) every new version. This is useful if you want to enforce invalidate cache agains standard CDN cache policies every new version you deploy

examples

{
  "versionedAssets": "true"
}
{
  "versionedAssets": "false"
}

platforms.firefoxtv.webpackConfigâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.firefoxtv.webpackConfig

type object

platforms.firefoxtv.webpackConfig.customScriptsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.firefoxtv.webpackConfig.customScripts

type array

platforms.firefoxtv.webpackConfig.devServerHostâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.firefoxtv.webpackConfig.devServerHost

type string

platforms.firefoxtv.webpackConfig.extendâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.firefoxtv.webpackConfig.extend

type object

Allows you to directly extend/override webpack config of your current platform

examples

{
  "extend": {
    "devtool": "source-map"
  }
}
{
  "extend": {
    "module": {
      "rules": [
        {
          "test": {},
          "use": [
            "source-map-loader"
          ],
          "enforce": "pre"
        }
      ]
    }
  }
}

path renative.json/#/platforms.ios.buildSchemes.[object].includedPermissions

type array

Allows you to include specific permissions by their KEY defined in permissions object

examples

{
  "includedPermissions": [
    "*"
  ]
}
{
  "includedPermissions": [
    "INTERNET",
    "CAMERA",
    "SYSTEM_ALERT_WINDOW",
    "RECORD_AUDIO",
    "RECORD_VIDEO",
    "READ_EXTERNAL_STORAGE",
    "WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE",
    "ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION",
    "ACCESS_COARSE_LOCATION",
    "VIBRATE",
    "ACCESS_NETWORK_STATE",
    "ACCESS_WIFI_STATE",
    "RECEIVE_BOOT_COMPLETED",
    "WRITE_CONTACTS",
    "READ_CONTACTS"
  ]

path renative.json/#/platforms.ios.buildSchemes.[object].includedPlugins

Defines an array of all included plugins for specific config or buildScheme. only full keys as defined in plugin should be used.

NOTE: includedPlugins is evaluated before excludedPlugins

  "includedPlugins": [
    "*"
  ]
}

  "includedPlugins": [
    "react-native-google-cast",
    "react-navigation-tabs"

type object

{
  "orientationSupport": {
    "phone": [
      "UIInterfaceOrientationPortrait",
      "UIInterfaceOrientationPortraitUpsideDown",
      "UIInterfaceOrientationLandscapeLeft",
      "UIInterfaceOrientationLandscapeRight"
    ],
    "tab": [
      "UIInterfaceOrientationPortrait",
      "UIInterfaceOrientationPortraitUpsideDown",
      "UIInterfaceOrientationLandscapeLeft",
      "UIInterfaceOrientationLandscapeRight"
    ]
  }
}

platforms.ios.buildSchemes.[object].systemCapabilitiesâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.ios.buildSchemes.[object].systemCapabilities

type object

examples

{
  "systemCapabilities": {
    "com.apple.SafariKeychain": false,
    "com.apple.Wallet": false,
    "com.apple.HealthKit": false,
    "com.apple.ApplicationGroups.iOS": false,
    "com.apple.iCloud": true,
    "com.apple.DataProtection": false,
    "com.apple.HomeKit": false,
    "com.apple.ClassKit": false,
    "com.apple.VPNLite": false,
    "com.apple.AutoFillCredentialProvider": false,
    "com.apple.AccessWiFi": false,
    "com.apple.InAppPurchase": false,
    "com.apple.HotspotConfiguration": false,
    "com.apple.Multipath": false,
    "com.apple.GameCenter.iOS": false,
    "com.apple.BackgroundModes": false,
    "com.apple.InterAppAudio": false,
    "com.apple.WAC": false,
    "com.apple.Push": true,
    "com.apple.NearFieldCommunicationTagReading": false,
    "com.apple.ApplePay": false,
    "com.apple.Keychain": false,
    "com.apple.Maps.iOS": false,
    "com.apple.Siri": false,
    "com.apple.NetworkExtensions.iOS": false
  }
}

platforms.ios.buildSchemes.[object].timestampAssetsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.ios.buildSchemes.[object].timestampAssets

If set to true generated js (bundle.js) files will be timestamped and named (bundle-12345678.js) every new build. This is useful if you want to enforce invalidate cache agains standard CDN cache policies every new build you deploy

examples

{
  "timestampAssets": "true"
}
{
  "timestampAssets": "false"
}

examples

{
  "codeSignIdentity": "iPhone Developer"
}
{
  "codeSignIdentity": "iPhone Distribution"
}

platforms.ios.deployâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.ios.deploy

type object

type string

path renative.json/#/platforms.ios.deploymentTarget

platforms.ios.descriptionâ€‹

type string

General description of your app. This prop will be injected to actual projects where description field is applicable

  "description": "This app does awesome things"

platforms.ios.excludedPluginsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.ios.excludedPlugins

type array

Defines an array of all excluded plugins for specific config or buildScheme. only full keys as defined in plugin should be used.

NOTE: excludedPlugins is evaluated after includedPlugins

examples

{
  "excludedPlugins": [
    "*"
  ]
}
{
  "excludedPlugins": [
    "react-native-google-cast",
    "react-navigation-tabs"
  ]
}

path renative.json/#/platforms.ios.ignoreWarnings

type boolean

platforms.ios.includedFontsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.ios.includedFonts

type array

Array of fonts you want to include in specific app or scheme. Should use exact font file (without the extension) located in ./appConfigs/base/fonts or * to mark all

examples

{
  "includedFonts": [
    "*"
  ]
}
{
  "includedFonts": [
    "TimeBurner",
    "Entypo"
  ]
}

platforms.ios.includedPermissionsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.ios.includedPermissions

type array

Allows you to include specific permissions by their KEY defined in permissions object

examples

{
  "includedPermissions": [
    "*"
  ]
}
{
  "includedPermissions": [
    "INTERNET",
    "CAMERA",
    "SYSTEM_ALERT_WINDOW",
    "RECORD_AUDIO",
    "RECORD_VIDEO",
    "READ_EXTERNAL_STORAGE",
    "WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE",
    "ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION",
    "ACCESS_COARSE_LOCATION",
    "VIBRATE",
    "ACCESS_NETWORK_STATE",
    "ACCESS_WIFI_STATE",
    "RECEIVE_BOOT_COMPLETED",
    "WRITE_CONTACTS",
    "READ_CONTACTS"
  ]
}

platforms.ios.includedPluginsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.ios.includedPlugins

type array

Defines an array of all included plugins for specific config or buildScheme. only full keys as defined in plugin should be used.

NOTE: includedPlugins is evaluated before excludedPlugins

examples

{
  "includedPlugins": [
    "*"
  ]
}
{
  "includedPlugins": [
    "react-native-google-cast",
    "react-navigation-tabs"
  ]
}

path renative.json/#/platforms.ios.license

type string

path renative.json/#/platforms.ios.orientationSupport

type object

examples

{
  "orientationSupport": {
    "phone": [
      "UIInterfaceOrientationPortrait",
      "UIInterfaceOrientationPortraitUpsideDown",
      "UIInterfaceOrientationLandscapeLeft",
      "UIInterfaceOrientationLandscapeRight"
    ],
    "tab": [
      "UIInterfaceOrientationPortrait",
      "UIInterfaceOrientationPortraitUpsideDown",
      "UIInterfaceOrientationLandscapeLeft",
      "UIInterfaceOrientationLandscapeRight"
    ]
  }
}
