platforms.ios.systemCapabilitiesâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.ios.systemCapabilities

type object

examples

{
  "systemCapabilities": {
    "com.apple.SafariKeychain": false,
    "com.apple.Wallet": false,
    "com.apple.HealthKit": false,
    "com.apple.ApplicationGroups.iOS": false,
    "com.apple.iCloud": true,
    "com.apple.DataProtection": false,
    "com.apple.HomeKit": false,
    "com.apple.ClassKit": false,
    "com.apple.VPNLite": false,
    "com.apple.AutoFillCredentialProvider": false,
    "com.apple.AccessWiFi": false,
    "com.apple.InAppPurchase": false,
    "com.apple.HotspotConfiguration": false,
    "com.apple.Multipath": false,
    "com.apple.GameCenter.iOS": false,
    "com.apple.BackgroundModes": false,
    "com.apple.InterAppAudio": false,
    "com.apple.WAC": false,
    "com.apple.Push": true,
    "com.apple.NearFieldCommunicationTagReading": false,
    "com.apple.ApplePay": false,
    "com.apple.Keychain": false,
    "com.apple.Maps.iOS": false,
    "com.apple.Siri": false,
    "com.apple.NetworkExtensions.iOS": false
  }
}

platforms.ios.teamIDâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.ios.teamID

type string

platforms.ios.teamIdentifierâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.ios.teamIdentifier

type string

platforms.ios.testFlightIdâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.ios.testFlightId

type string

platforms.ios.timestampAssetsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.ios.timestampAssets

type boolean

If set to true generated js (bundle.js) files will be timestamped and named (bundle-12345678.js) every new build. This is useful if you want to enforce invalidate cache agains standard CDN cache policies every new build you deploy

examples

{
  "timestampAssets": "true"
}
{
  "timestampAssets": "false"
}

platforms.ios.titleâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.ios.title

type string

Title of your app will be used to create title of the binary. ie App title of installed app iOS/Android app or Tab title of the website

examples

{
  "title": "Awesome App"
}

platforms.ios.versionedAssetsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.ios.versionedAssets

type boolean

If set to true generated js (bundle.js) files will be timestamped and named (bundle-1.0.0.js) every new version. This is useful if you want to enforce invalidate cache agains standard CDN cache policies every new version you deploy

examples

{
  "versionedAssets": "true"
}
{
  "versionedAssets": "false"
}

platforms.ios.xcodeprojâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.ios.xcodeproj

type object

platforms.kaios.backgroundColorâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.kaios.backgroundColor

  "backgroundColor": "#FFFFFF"
}
{
  "backgroundColor": "#222222"
}

platforms.kaios.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfig.devServerHostâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.kaios.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfig.devServerHost

type string

platforms.kaios.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfig.extendâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.kaios.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfig.extend

type object

Allows you to directly extend/override webpack config of your current platform

examples

{
  "extend": {
    "devtool": "source-map"
  }
}
{
  "extend": {
    "module": {
      "rules": [
        {
          "test": {},
          "use": [
            "source-map-loader"
          ],
          "enforce": "pre"
        }
      ]
    }
  }
}

            "source-map-loader"
          ],
          "enforce": "pre"
        }
      ]
    }
  }
}

platforms.kaios.webpackConfig.metaTagsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.kaios.webpackConfig.metaTags

type object

platforms.macosâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.macos

type object

platforms.macos.BrowserWindowâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.macos.BrowserWindow

type object

Allows you to configure electron wrapper app window

examples

{
  "BrowserWindow": {
    "width": 1310,
    "height": 800,
    "webPreferences": {
      "devTools": true
    }
  }
}

platforms.macos.BrowserWindow.heightâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.macos.BrowserWindow.height

type integer

Default height of electron app

platforms.macos.BrowserWindow.webPreferencesâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.macos.BrowserWindow.webPreferences

type object

Extra web preferences of electron app

examples

{
  "webPreferences": {
    "devTools": true
  }
}

platforms.macos.BrowserWindow.widthâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.macos.BrowserWindow.width

type integer

platforms.macos.backgroundColorâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.macos.backgroundColor

type string

Defines root view backgroundColor for all platforms in HEX format

examples

{
  "backgroundColor": "#FFFFFF"
}
{
  "backgroundColor": "#222222"
}

      "devTools": true

platforms.macos.buildSchemes.[object].descriptionâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.macos.buildSchemes.[object].description

type string

General description of your app. This prop will be injected to actual projects where description field is applicable

examples

{
  "description": "This app does awesome things"
}

platforms.macos.buildSchemes.[object].electronConfigâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.macos.buildSchemes.[object].electronConfig

type object

Allows you to configure electron app as per https://www.electron.build/

examples

{
  "electronConfig": {
    "mac": {
      "target": [
        "dmg",
        "mas",
        "mas-dev"
      ],
      "hardenedRuntime": true
    },
    "dmg": {
      "sign": false
    },
    "mas": {
      "type": "distribution",
      "hardenedRuntime": false
    }
  }
}

platforms.macos.buildSchemes.[object].enabledâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.macos.buildSchemes.[object].enabled

type boolean

platforms.macos.buildSchemes.[object].engineâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.macos.buildSchemes.[object].engine

type string

platforms.macos.buildSchemes.[object].entryFileâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.macos.buildSchemes.[object].entryFile

type string

platforms.macos.buildSchemes.[object].excludedPluginsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.macos.buildSchemes.[object].excludedPlugins

type array

Defines an array of all excluded plugins for specific config or buildScheme. only full keys as defined in plugin should be used.

NOTE: excludedPlugins is evaluated after includedPlugins

examples

{
  "excludedPlugins": [
    "*"
  ]
}
{
  "excludedPlugins": [
    "react-native-google-cast",
    "react-navigation-tabs"
  ]
}

platforms.macos.buildSchemes.[object].extâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.macos.buildSchemes.[object].ext

type object

Object ysed to extend your renative with custom props. This allows renative json schema to be validated

examples

{
  "ext": {
    "myCustomRenativeProp": "foo"
  }
}

platforms.macos.buildSchemes.[object].idâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.macos.buildSchemes.[object].id

type string

platforms.macos.buildSchemes.[object].ignoreLogsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.macos.buildSchemes.[object].ignoreLogs

type boolean

platforms.macos.buildSchemes.[object].ignoreWarningsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.macos.buildSchemes.[object].ignoreWarnings

type boolean

platforms.macos.buildSchemes.[object].includedFontsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.macos.buildSchemes.[object].includedFonts

type array

Array of fonts you want to include in specific app or scheme. Should use exact font file (without the extension) located in ./appConfigs/base/fonts or * to mark all

examples

{
  "includedFonts": [
    "*"
  ]
}
{
  "includedFonts": [
    "TimeBurner",
    "Entypo"
  ]
}

platforms.macos.buildSchemes.[object].includedPermissionsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.macos.buildSchemes.[object].includedPermissions

type array

Allows you to include specific permissions by their KEY defined in permissions object

examples

{
  "includedPermissions": [
    "*"
  ]
}
{
  "includedPermissions": [
    "INTERNET",
    "CAMERA",
    "SYSTEM_ALERT_WINDOW",
    "RECORD_AUDIO",
    "RECORD_VIDEO",
    "READ_EXTERNAL_STORAGE",
    "WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE",
    "ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION",
    "ACCESS_COARSE_LOCATION",
    "VIBRATE",
    "ACCESS_NETWORK_STATE",
    "ACCESS_WIFI_STATE",
    "RECEIVE_BOOT_COMPLETED",
    "WRITE_CONTACTS",
    "READ_CONTACTS"
  ]
}

platforms.macos.buildSchemes.[object].includedPluginsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.macos.buildSchemes.[object].includedPlugins

type array

Defines an array of all included plugins for specific config or buildScheme. only full keys as defined in plugin should be used.

NOTE: includedPlugins is evaluated before excludedPlugins

examples

{
  "includedPlugins": [
    "*"
  ]
}
{
  "includedPlugins": [
    "react-native-google-cast",
    "react-navigation-tabs"
  ]
}

platforms.macos.buildSchemes.[object].licenseâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.macos.buildSchemes.[object].license

type string

platforms.macos.buildSchemes.[object].permissionsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.macos.buildSchemes.[object].permissions

type array

DEPRECATED in favor of includedPermissions

platforms.macos.buildSchemes.[object].runtimeâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.macos.buildSchemes.[object].runtime

type object

This object will be automatically injected into ./platfromAssets/renative.runtime.json making it possible to inject the values directly to JS source code

examples

{
  "runtime": {
    "someRuntimeProperty": "foo"
  }
}

platforms.macos.buildSchemes.[object].splashScreenâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.macos.buildSchemes.[object].splashScreen

type boolean

platforms.macos.buildSchemes.[object].timestampAssetsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.macos.buildSchemes.[object].timestampAssets

type boolean

If set to true generated js (bundle.js) files will be timestamped and named (bundle-12345678.js) every new build. This is useful if you want to enforce invalidate cache agains standard CDN cache policies every new build you deploy

examples

{
  "timestampAssets": "true"
}
{
  "timestampAssets": "false"
}

platforms.macos.buildSchemes.[object].titleâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.macos.buildSchemes.[object].title

type string

Title of your app will be used to create title of the binary. ie App title of installed app iOS/Android app or Tab title of the website

examples

{
  "title": "Awesome App"
}

platforms.macos.buildSchemes.[object].versionedAssetsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.macos.buildSchemes.[object].versionedAssets

type boolean

If set to true generated js (bundle.js) files will be timestamped and named (bundle-1.0.0.js) every new version. This is useful if you want to enforce invalidate cache agains standard CDN cache policies every new version you deploy

examples

{
  "versionedAssets": "true"
}
{
  "versionedAssets": "false"
}

platforms.macos.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfigâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.macos.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfig

type object

platforms.macos.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfig.customScriptsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.macos.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfig.customScripts

type array

platforms.macos.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfig.devServerHostâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.macos.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfig.devServerHost

type string

platforms.macos.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfig.extendâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.macos.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfig.extend

type object

Allows you to directly extend/override webpack config of your current platform

examples

{
  "extend": {
    "devtool": "source-map"
  }
}
{
  "extend": {
    "module": {
      "rules": [
        {
          "test": {},
          "use": [
            "source-map-loader"
          ],
          "enforce": "pre"
        }
      ]
    }
  }
}

platforms.macos.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfig.metaTagsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.macos.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfig.metaTags

  }
}

platforms.tizen.buildSchemes.[object].splashScreenâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tizen.buildSchemes.[object].splashScreen

type boolean

platforms.tizen.buildSchemes.[object].timestampAssetsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tizen.buildSchemes.[object].timestampAssets

type boolean

If set to true generated js (bundle.js) files will be timestamped and named (bundle-12345678.js) every new build. This is useful if you want to enforce invalidate cache agains standard CDN cache policies every new build you deploy

examples

{
  "timestampAssets": "true"
}
{
  "timestampAssets": "false"
}

platforms.tizen.buildSchemes.[object].titleâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tizen.buildSchemes.[object].title

type string

Title of your app will be used to create title of the binary. ie App title of installed app iOS/Android app or Tab title of the website

examples

{
  "title": "Awesome App"
}

platforms.tizen.buildSchemes.[object].versionedAssetsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tizen.buildSchemes.[object].versionedAssets

type boolean

If set to true generated js (bundle.js) files will be timestamped and named (bundle-1.0.0.js) every new version. This is useful if you want to enforce invalidate cache agains standard CDN cache policies every new version you deploy

examples

{
  "versionedAssets": "true"
}
{
  "versionedAssets": "false"
}

platforms.tizen.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfigâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tizen.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfig

type object

platforms.tizen.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfig.customScriptsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tizen.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfig.customScripts

type array

platforms.tizen.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfig.devServerHostâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tizen.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfig.devServerHost

type string

platforms.tizen.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfig.extendâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tizen.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfig.extend

type object

Allows you to directly extend/override webpack config of your current platform

examples

{
  "extend": {
    "devtool": "source-map"
  }
}
{
  "extend": {
    "module": {
      "rules": [
        {
          "test": {},
          "use": [
            "source-map-loader"
          ],
          "enforce": "pre"
        }
      ]
    }
  }
}

platforms.tizen.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfig.metaTagsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tizen.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfig.metaTags

type object

type string

platforms.tizen.descriptionâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tizen.description

type string

General description of your app. This prop will be injected to actual projects where description field is applicable

examples

{
  "description": "This app does awesome things"
}

platforms.tizen.devServerHostâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tizen.devServerHost

type string

platforms.tizen.engineâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tizen.engine

type string

platforms.tizen.entryFileâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tizen.entryFile

type string

platforms.tizen.excludedPluginsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tizen.excludedPlugins

type array

Defines an array of all excluded plugins for specific config or buildScheme. only full keys as defined in plugin should be used.

NOTE: excludedPlugins is evaluated after includedPlugins

examples

{
  "excludedPlugins": [
    "*"
  ]
}
{
  "excludedPlugins": [
    "react-native-google-cast",
    "react-navigation-tabs"
  ]
}

platforms.tizen.extâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tizen.ext

type object

Object ysed to extend your renative with custom props. This allows renative json schema to be validated

examples

{
  "ext": {
    "myCustomRenativeProp": "foo"
  }
}

platforms.tizen.idâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tizen.id

type string

platforms.tizen.ignoreLogsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tizen.ignoreLogs

type boolean

platforms.tizen.ignoreWarningsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tizen.ignoreWarnings

type boolean

platforms.tizen.includedFontsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tizen.includedFonts

type array

Array of fonts you want to include in specific app or scheme. Should use exact font file (without the extension) located in ./appConfigs/base/fonts or * to mark all

examples

{
  "includedFonts": [
    "*"
  ]
}
{
  "includedFonts": [
    "TimeBurner",
    "Entypo"
  ]
}

platforms.tizen.includedPermissionsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tizen.includedPermissions

type array

Allows you to include specific permissions by their KEY defined in permissions object

examples

{
  "includedPermissions": [
    "*"
  ]
}
{
  "includedPermissions": [
    "INTERNET",
    "CAMERA",
    "SYSTEM_ALERT_WINDOW",
    "RECORD_AUDIO",
    "RECORD_VIDEO",
    "READ_EXTERNAL_STORAGE",
    "WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE",
    "ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION",
    "ACCESS_COARSE_LOCATION",
    "VIBRATE",
    "ACCESS_NETWORK_STATE",
    "ACCESS_WIFI_STATE",
    "RECEIVE_BOOT_COMPLETED",
    "WRITE_CONTACTS",
    "READ_CONTACTS"
  ]
}

platforms.tizen.includedPluginsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tizen.includedPlugins

type array

Defines an array of all included plugins for specific config or buildScheme. only full keys as defined in plugin should be used.

NOTE: includedPlugins is evaluated before excludedPlugins

examples

{
  "includedPlugins": [
    "*"
  ]
}
{
  "includedPlugins": [
    "react-native-google-cast",
    "react-navigation-tabs"
  ]
}

platforms.tizen.licenseâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tizen.license

type string

platforms.tizen.packageâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tizen.package

type string

platforms.tizen.permissionsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tizen.permissions

type array

DEPRECATED in favor of includedPermissions

platforms.tizen.runtimeâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tizen.runtime

type object

This object will be automatically injected into ./platfromAssets/renative.runtime.json making it possible to inject the values directly to JS source code

examples

{
  "runtime": {
    "someRuntimeProperty": "foo"
  }
}

  "backgroundColor": "#FFFFFF"
}
{
  "backgroundColor": "#222222"
}

platforms.tizenmobile.webpackConfig.extendâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tizenmobile.webpackConfig.extend

type object

Allows you to directly extend/override webpack config of your current platform

examples

{
  "extend": {
    "devtool": "source-map"
  }
}
{
  "extend": {
    "module": {
      "rules": [
        {
          "test": {},
          "use": [
            "source-map-loader"
          ],
          "enforce": "pre"
        }
      ]
    }
  }
}

platforms.tizenmobile.webpackConfig.metaTagsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tizenmobile.webpackConfig.metaTags

type object

platforms.tizenwatchâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tizenwatch

type object

platforms.tizenwatch.appNameâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tizenwatch.appName

type string

platforms.tizenwatch.authorâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tizenwatch.author

type object

platforms.tizenwatch.backgroundColorâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tizenwatch.backgroundColor

type string

Defines root view backgroundColor for all platforms in HEX format

examples

{
  "backgroundColor": "#FFFFFF"
}
{
  "backgroundColor": "#222222"
}

platforms.tizenwatch.buildSchemesâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tizenwatch.buildSchemes

type object

path renative.json/#/platforms.tizenwatch.buildSchemes.[object].appName

type string

platforms.tizenwatch.buildSchemes.[object].authorâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tizenwatch.buildSchemes.[object].author

type object

platforms.tizenwatch.buildSchemes.[object].backgroundColorâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tizenwatch.buildSchemes.[object].backgroundColor

type string

Defines root view backgroundColor for all platforms in HEX format

examples

{
  "backgroundColor": "#FFFFFF"
}
{
  "backgroundColor": "#222222"
}

platforms.tizenwatch.buildSchemes.[object].bundleAssetsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tizenwatch.buildSchemes.[object].bundleAssets

type boolean

path renative.json/#/platforms.tizenwatch.buildSchemes.[object].bundleIsDev

path renative.json/#/platforms.tizenwatch.buildSchemes.[object].certificateProfile

path renative.json/#/platforms.tizenwatch.buildSchemes.[object].deploy

type object

platforms.tizenwatch.buildSchemes.[object].deploy.typeâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tizenwatch.buildSchemes.[object].deploy.type

type string

platforms.tizenwatch.buildSchemes.[object].descriptionâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tizenwatch.buildSchemes.[object].description

type string

General description of your app. This prop will be injected to actual projects where description field is applicable

examples

{
  "description": "This app does awesome things"
}

platforms.tizenwatch.buildSchemes.[object].devServerHostâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tizenwatch.buildSchemes.[object].devServerHost

type string

platforms.tizenwatch.buildSchemes.[object].enabledâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tizenwatch.buildSchemes.[object].enabled

type boolean

platforms.tizenwatch.buildSchemes.[object].engineâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tizenwatch.buildSchemes.[object].engine

type string

platforms.tizenwatch.buildSchemes.[object].entryFileâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tizenwatch.buildSchemes.[object].entryFile

type string

platforms.tizenwatch.buildSchemes.[object].excludedPluginsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tizenwatch.buildSchemes.[object].excludedPlugins

type array

Defines an array of all excluded plugins for specific config or buildScheme. only full keys as defined in plugin should be used.

NOTE: excludedPlugins is evaluated after includedPlugins

examples

{
  "excludedPlugins": [
    "*"
  ]
}
{
  "excludedPlugins": [
    "react-native-google-cast",
    "react-navigation-tabs"
  ]
}

platforms.tizenwatch.buildSchemes.[object].extâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tizenwatch.buildSchemes.[object].ext

type object

Object ysed to extend your renative with custom props. This allows renative json schema to be validated

examples

{
  "ext": {
    "myCustomRenativeProp": "foo"
  }
}

platforms.tizenwatch.buildSchemes.[object].idâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tizenwatch.buildSchemes.[object].id

type string

platforms.tizenwatch.buildSchemes.[object].ignoreLogsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tizenwatch.buildSchemes.[object].ignoreLogs

type boolean

platforms.tizenwatch.buildSchemes.[object].ignoreWarningsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tizenwatch.buildSchemes.[object].ignoreWarnings

type boolean

platforms.tizenwatch.buildSchemes.[object].includedFontsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tizenwatch.buildSchemes.[object].includedFonts

type array

Array of fonts you want to include in specific app or scheme. Should use exact font file (without the extension) located in ./appConfigs/base/fonts or * to mark all

examples

{
  "includedFonts": [
    "*"
  ]
}
{
  "includedFonts": [
    "TimeBurner",
    "Entypo"
  ]
}

platforms.tizenwatch.buildSchemes.[object].includedPermissionsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tizenwatch.buildSchemes.[object].includedPermissions

type array

Allows you to include specific permissions by their KEY defined in permissions object

examples

{
  "includedPermissions": [
    "*"
  ]
}
{
  "includedPermissions": [
    "INTERNET",
    "CAMERA",
    "SYSTEM_ALERT_WINDOW",
    "RECORD_AUDIO",
    "RECORD_VIDEO",
    "READ_EXTERNAL_STORAGE",
    "WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE",
    "ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION",
    "ACCESS_COARSE_LOCATION",
    "VIBRATE",
    "ACCESS_NETWORK_STATE",
    "ACCESS_WIFI_STATE",
    "RECEIVE_BOOT_COMPLETED",
    "WRITE_CONTACTS",
    "READ_CONTACTS"
  ]
}

platforms.tizenwatch.buildSchemes.[object].includedPluginsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tizenwatch.buildSchemes.[object].includedPlugins

type array

Defines an array of all included plugins for specific config or buildScheme. only full keys as defined in plugin should be used.

NOTE: includedPlugins is evaluated before excludedPlugins

examples

{
  "includedPlugins": [
    "*"
  ]
}
{
  "includedPlugins": [
    "react-native-google-cast",
    "react-navigation-tabs"
  ]
}

platforms.tizenwatch.buildSchemes.[object].licenseâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tizenwatch.buildSchemes.[object].license

type string

platforms.tizenwatch.buildSchemes.[object].packageâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tizenwatch.buildSchemes.[object].package

type string

platforms.tizenwatch.buildSchemes.[object].permissionsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tizenwatch.buildSchemes.[object].permissions

type array

DEPRECATED in favor of includedPermissions

platforms.tizenwatch.buildSchemes.[object].runtimeâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tizenwatch.buildSchemes.[object].runtime

type object

This object will be automatically injected into ./platfromAssets/renative.runtime.json making it possible to inject the values directly to JS source code

examples

{
  "runtime": {
    "someRuntimeProperty": "foo"
  }
}

platforms.tizenwatch.buildSchemes.[object].splashScreenâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tizenwatch.buildSchemes.[object].splashScreen

type boolean

platforms.tizenwatch.buildSchemes.[object].timestampAssetsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tizenwatch.buildSchemes.[object].timestampAssets

type boolean

If set to true generated js (bundle.js) files will be timestamped and named (bundle-12345678.js) every new build. This is useful if you want to enforce invalidate cache agains standard CDN cache policies every new build you deploy

examples

{
  "timestampAssets": "true"
}
{
  "timestampAssets": "false"
}

platforms.tizenwatch.buildSchemes.[object].titleâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tizenwatch.buildSchemes.[object].title

type string

Title of your app will be used to create title of the binary. ie App title of installed app iOS/Android app or Tab title of the website

examples

{
  "title": "Awesome App"
}

platforms.tizenwatch.buildSchemes.[object].versionedAssetsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tizenwatch.buildSchemes.[object].versionedAssets

type boolean

If set to true generated js (bundle.js) files will be timestamped and named (bundle-1.0.0.js) every new version. This is useful if you want to enforce invalidate cache agains standard CDN cache policies every new version you deploy

examples

{
  "versionedAssets": "true"
}
{
  "versionedAssets": "false"
}

platforms.tizenwatch.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfigâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tizenwatch.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfig

type object

path renative.json/#/platforms.tizenwatch.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfig.customScripts

type array

platforms.tizenwatch.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfig.devServerHostâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tizenwatch.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfig.devServerHost

type string

platforms.tizenwatch.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfig.extendâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tizenwatch.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfig.extend

type object

Allows you to directly extend/override webpack config of your current platform

examples

{
  "extend": {
    "devtool": "source-map"
  }
}
{
  "extend": {
    "module": {
      "rules": [
        {
          "test": {},
          "use": [
            "source-map-loader"
          ],
          "enforce": "pre"
        }
      ]
    }
  }
}

type string

platforms.tvos.buildSchemes.[object].exportOptions.provisioningProfilesâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tvos.buildSchemes.[object].exportOptions.provisioningProfiles

type object

platforms.tvos.buildSchemes.[object].exportOptions.signingCertificateâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tvos.buildSchemes.[object].exportOptions.signingCertificate

type string

platforms.tvos.buildSchemes.[object].exportOptions.signingStyleâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tvos.buildSchemes.[object].exportOptions.signingStyle

type string

platforms.tvos.buildSchemes.[object].exportOptions.teamIDâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tvos.buildSchemes.[object].exportOptions.teamID

type string

platforms.tvos.buildSchemes.[object].exportOptions.uploadBitcodeâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tvos.buildSchemes.[object].exportOptions.uploadBitcode

type boolean

platforms.tvos.buildSchemes.[object].exportOptions.uploadSymbolsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tvos.buildSchemes.[object].exportOptions.uploadSymbols

type boolean

platforms.tvos.buildSchemes.[object].extâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tvos.buildSchemes.[object].ext

type object

Object ysed to extend your renative with custom props. This allows renative json schema to be validated

examples

{
  "ext": {
    "myCustomRenativeProp": "foo"
  }
}

platforms.tvos.buildSchemes.[object].firebaseIdâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tvos.buildSchemes.[object].firebaseId

type string

platforms.tvos.buildSchemes.[object].idâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tvos.buildSchemes.[object].id

type string

platforms.tvos.buildSchemes.[object].ignoreLogsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tvos.buildSchemes.[object].ignoreLogs

type boolean

platforms.tvos.buildSchemes.[object].ignoreWarningsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tvos.buildSchemes.[object].ignoreWarnings

type boolean

platforms.tvos.buildSchemes.[object].includedFontsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tvos.buildSchemes.[object].includedFonts

type array

Array of fonts you want to include in specific app or scheme. Should use exact font file (without the extension) located in ./appConfigs/base/fonts or * to mark all

examples

{
  "includedFonts": [
    "*"
  ]
}
{
  "includedFonts": [
    "TimeBurner",
    "Entypo"
  ]
}

platforms.tvos.buildSchemes.[object].includedPermissionsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tvos.buildSchemes.[object].includedPermissions

type array

Allows you to include specific permissions by their KEY defined in permissions object

examples

{
  "includedPermissions": [
    "*"
  ]
}
{
  "includedPermissions": [
    "INTERNET",
    "CAMERA",
    "SYSTEM_ALERT_WINDOW",
    "RECORD_AUDIO",
    "RECORD_VIDEO",
    "READ_EXTERNAL_STORAGE",
    "WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE",
    "ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION",
    "ACCESS_COARSE_LOCATION",
    "VIBRATE",
    "ACCESS_NETWORK_STATE",
    "ACCESS_WIFI_STATE",
    "RECEIVE_BOOT_COMPLETED",
    "WRITE_CONTACTS",
    "READ_CONTACTS"
  ]
}

platforms.tvos.buildSchemes.[object].includedPluginsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tvos.buildSchemes.[object].includedPlugins

type array

Defines an array of all included plugins for specific config or buildScheme. only full keys as defined in plugin should be used.

NOTE: includedPlugins is evaluated before excludedPlugins

examples

{
  "includedPlugins": [
    "*"
  ]
}
{
  "includedPlugins": [
    "react-native-google-cast",
    "react-navigation-tabs"
  ]
}

platforms.tvos.buildSchemes.[object].licenseâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tvos.buildSchemes.[object].license

type string

platforms.tvos.buildSchemes.[object].orientationSupportâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tvos.buildSchemes.[object].orientationSupport

type object

examples

{
  "orientationSupport": {
    "phone": [
      "UIInterfaceOrientationPortrait",
      "UIInterfaceOrientationPortraitUpsideDown",
      "UIInterfaceOrientationLandscapeLeft",
      "UIInterfaceOrientationLandscapeRight"
    ],
    "tab": [
      "UIInterfaceOrientationPortrait",
      "UIInterfaceOrientationPortraitUpsideDown",
      "UIInterfaceOrientationLandscapeLeft",
      "UIInterfaceOrientationLandscapeRight"
    ]
  }
}

platforms.tvos.buildSchemes.[object].orientationSupport.phoneâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tvos.buildSchemes.[object].orientationSupport.phone

type array

type string

platforms.tvos.buildSchemes.[object].runtimeâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tvos.buildSchemes.[object].runtime

type object

This object will be automatically injected into ./platfromAssets/renative.runtime.json making it possible to inject the values directly to JS source code

examples

{
  "runtime": {
    "someRuntimeProperty": "foo"
  }
}

path renative.json/#/platforms.tvos.buildSchemes.[object].splashScreen

type boolean

platforms.tvos.buildSchemes.[object].systemCapabilitiesâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tvos.buildSchemes.[object].systemCapabilities

type object

examples

{
  "systemCapabilities": {
    "com.apple.SafariKeychain": false,
    "com.apple.Wallet": false,
    "com.apple.HealthKit": false,
    "com.apple.ApplicationGroups.iOS": false,
    "com.apple.iCloud": true,
    "com.apple.DataProtection": false,
    "com.apple.HomeKit": false,
    "com.apple.ClassKit": false,
    "com.apple.VPNLite": false,
    "com.apple.AutoFillCredentialProvider": false,
    "com.apple.AccessWiFi": false,
    "com.apple.InAppPurchase": false,
    "com.apple.HotspotConfiguration": false,
    "com.apple.Multipath": false,
    "com.apple.GameCenter.iOS": false,
    "com.apple.BackgroundModes": false,
    "com.apple.InterAppAudio": false,
    "com.apple.WAC": false,
    "com.apple.Push": true,
    "com.apple.NearFieldCommunicationTagReading": false,
    "com.apple.ApplePay": false,
    "com.apple.Keychain": false,
    "com.apple.Maps.iOS": false,
    "com.apple.Siri": false,
    "com.apple.NetworkExtensions.iOS": false
  }
}

platforms.tvos.buildSchemes.[object].teamIDâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tvos.buildSchemes.[object].teamID

type string

platforms.tvos.buildSchemes.[object].teamIdentifierâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tvos.buildSchemes.[object].teamIdentifier

type string

platforms.tvos.buildSchemes.[object].testFlightIdâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tvos.buildSchemes.[object].testFlightId

type string

platforms.tvos.buildSchemes.[object].timestampAssetsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tvos.buildSchemes.[object].timestampAssets

type boolean

If set to true generated js (bundle.js) files will be timestamped and named (bundle-12345678.js) every new build. This is useful if you want to enforce invalidate cache agains standard CDN cache policies every new build you deploy

examples

{
  "timestampAssets": "true"
}
{
  "timestampAssets": "false"
}

platforms.tvos.buildSchemes.[object].titleâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tvos.buildSchemes.[object].title

type string

Title of your app will be used to create title of the binary. ie App title of installed app iOS/Android app or Tab title of the website

examples

{
  "title": "Awesome App"
}

platforms.tvos.buildSchemes.[object].versionedAssetsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tvos.buildSchemes.[object].versionedAssets

type boolean

If set to true generated js (bundle.js) files will be timestamped and named (bundle-1.0.0.js) every new version. This is useful if you want to enforce invalidate cache agains standard CDN cache policies every new version you deploy

examples

{
  "versionedAssets": "true"
}
{
  "versionedAssets": "false"
}

platforms.tvos.buildSchemes.[object].xcodeprojâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tvos.buildSchemes.[object].xcodeproj

type object

type boolean

platforms.tvos.codeSignIdentityâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tvos.codeSignIdentity

type string

Special property which tells Xcode how to build your project

examples

{
  "codeSignIdentity": "iPhone Developer"
}
{
  "codeSignIdentity": "iPhone Distribution"
}

platforms.tvos.excludedPluginsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.tvos.excludedPlugins

type array

Defines an array of all excluded plugins for specific config or buildScheme. only full keys as defined in plugin should be used.

NOTE: excludedPlugins is evaluated after includedPlugins

examples

{
  "excludedPlugins": [
    "*"
  ]
}
{
  "excludedPlugins": [
    "react-native-google-cast",
    "react-navigation-tabs"
  ]
}

  "timestampAssets": "true"
}

  "timestampAssets": "false"

path renative.json/#/platforms.tvos.versionedAssets

  "versionedAssets": "true"
}

  "versionedAssets": "false"

  "backgroundColor": "#222222"

path renative.json/#/platforms.web.buildSchemes.[object].includedPlugins

type array

Defines an array of all included plugins for specific config or buildScheme. only full keys as defined in plugin should be used.

NOTE: includedPlugins is evaluated before excludedPlugins

examples

{
  "includedPlugins": [
    "*"
  ]
}
{
  "includedPlugins": [
    "react-native-google-cast",
    "react-navigation-tabs"
  ]
}

platforms.web.buildSchemes.[object].licenseâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.web.buildSchemes.[object].license

type string

platforms.web.buildSchemes.[object].pagesDirâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.web.buildSchemes.[object].pagesDir

type string

platforms.web.buildSchemes.[object].permissionsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.web.buildSchemes.[object].permissions

type array

DEPRECATED in favor of includedPermissions

platforms.web.buildSchemes.[object].runtimeâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.web.buildSchemes.[object].runtime

type object

This object will be automatically injected into ./platfromAssets/renative.runtime.json making it possible to inject the values directly to JS source code

examples

{
  "runtime": {
    "someRuntimeProperty": "foo"
  }
}

platforms.web.buildSchemes.[object].splashScreenâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.web.buildSchemes.[object].splashScreen

type boolean

platforms.web.buildSchemes.[object].timestampAssetsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.web.buildSchemes.[object].timestampAssets

type boolean

If set to true generated js (bundle.js) files will be timestamped and named (bundle-12345678.js) every new build. This is useful if you want to enforce invalidate cache agains standard CDN cache policies every new build you deploy

examples

{
  "timestampAssets": "true"
}
{
  "timestampAssets": "false"
}

platforms.web.buildSchemes.[object].titleâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.web.buildSchemes.[object].title

type string

Title of your app will be used to create title of the binary. ie App title of installed app iOS/Android app or Tab title of the website

examples

{
  "title": "Awesome App"
}

platforms.web.buildSchemes.[object].versionedAssetsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.web.buildSchemes.[object].versionedAssets

type boolean

If set to true generated js (bundle.js) files will be timestamped and named (bundle-1.0.0.js) every new version. This is useful if you want to enforce invalidate cache agains standard CDN cache policies every new version you deploy

examples

{
  "versionedAssets": "true"
}
{
  "versionedAssets": "false"
}

platforms.web.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfigâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.web.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfig

type object

platforms.web.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfig.customScriptsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.web.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfig.customScripts

type array

platforms.web.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfig.devServerHostâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.web.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfig.devServerHost

type string

platforms.web.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfig.extendâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.web.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfig.extend

type object

Allows you to directly extend/override webpack config of your current platform

examples

{
  "extend": {
    "devtool": "source-map"
  }
}
{
  "extend": {
    "module": {
      "rules": [
        {
          "test": {},
          "use": [
            "source-map-loader"
          ],
          "enforce": "pre"
        }
      ]
    }
  }
}

platforms.web.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfig.metaTagsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.web.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfig.metaTags

type object

platforms.web.bundleAssetsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.web.bundleAssets

type boolean

platforms.web.bundleIsDevâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.web.bundleIsDev

type boolean

platforms.web.deployâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.web.deploy

type object

platforms.web.deploy.typeâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.web.deploy.type

type string

platforms.web.descriptionâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.web.description

type string

General description of your app. This prop will be injected to actual projects where description field is applicable

examples

{
  "description": "This app does awesome things"
}

platforms.web.devServerHostâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.web.devServerHost

type string

platforms.web.engineâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.web.engine

type string

platforms.web.entryFileâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.web.entryFile

type string

platforms.web.environmentâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.web.environment

type string

platforms.web.excludedPluginsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.web.excludedPlugins

type array

Defines an array of all excluded plugins for specific config or buildScheme. only full keys as defined in plugin should be used.

NOTE: excludedPlugins is evaluated after includedPlugins

examples

{
  "excludedPlugins": [
    "*"
  ]
}
{
  "excludedPlugins": [
    "react-native-google-cast",
    "react-navigation-tabs"
  ]
}

platforms.web.extâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.web.ext

type object

Object ysed to extend your renative with custom props. This allows renative json schema to be validated

examples

{
  "ext": {
    "myCustomRenativeProp": "foo"
  }
}

platforms.web.idâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.web.id

type string

platforms.web.ignoreLogsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.web.ignoreLogs

type boolean

platforms.web.ignoreWarningsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.web.ignoreWarnings

type boolean

platforms.web.includedFontsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.web.includedFonts

type array

Array of fonts you want to include in specific app or scheme. Should use exact font file (without the extension) located in ./appConfigs/base/fonts or * to mark all

examples

{
  "includedFonts": [
    "*"
  ]
}
{
  "includedFonts": [
    "TimeBurner",
    "Entypo"
  ]
}

platforms.web.includedPermissionsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.web.includedPermissions

type array

Allows you to include specific permissions by their KEY defined in permissions object

examples

{
  "includedPermissions": [
    "*"
  ]
}
{
  "includedPermissions": [
    "INTERNET",
    "CAMERA",
    "SYSTEM_ALERT_WINDOW",
    "RECORD_AUDIO",
    "RECORD_VIDEO",
    "READ_EXTERNAL_STORAGE",
    "WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE",
    "ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION",
    "ACCESS_COARSE_LOCATION",
    "VIBRATE",
    "ACCESS_NETWORK_STATE",
    "ACCESS_WIFI_STATE",
    "RECEIVE_BOOT_COMPLETED",
    "WRITE_CONTACTS",
    "READ_CONTACTS"
  ]
}

platforms.web.includedPluginsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.web.includedPlugins

type array

Defines an array of all included plugins for specific config or buildScheme. only full keys as defined in plugin should be used.

NOTE: includedPlugins is evaluated before excludedPlugins

examples

{
  "includedPlugins": [
    "*"
  ]
}
{
  "includedPlugins": [
    "react-native-google-cast",
    "react-navigation-tabs"
  ]
}

platforms.web.licenseâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.web.license

type string

platforms.web.pagesDirâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.web.pagesDir

type string

platforms.web.permissionsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.web.permissions

type array

DEPRECATED in favor of includedPermissions

platforms.web.runtimeâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.web.runtime

type object

This object will be automatically injected into ./platfromAssets/renative.runtime.json making it possible to inject the values directly to JS source code

examples

{
  "runtime": {
    "someRuntimeProperty": "foo"
  }
}

platforms.web.timestampAssetsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.web.timestampAssets

type boolean

If set to true generated js (bundle.js) files will be timestamped and named (bundle-12345678.js) every new build. This is useful if you want to enforce invalidate cache agains standard CDN cache policies every new build you deploy

examples

{
  "timestampAssets": "true"
}
{
  "timestampAssets": "false"
}

examples

{
  "title": "Awesome App"
}

path renative.json/#/platforms.web.versionedAssets

examples

  "versionedAssets": "true"
}

  "versionedAssets": "false"

    "devtool": "source-map"

    "module": {

type object

platforms.webos.backgroundColorâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.webos.backgroundColor

type string

Defines root view backgroundColor for all platforms in HEX format

examples

{
  "backgroundColor": "#FFFFFF"
}
{
  "backgroundColor": "#222222"
}

  "backgroundColor": "#FFFFFF"
}

  "backgroundColor": "#222222"

      "rules": [
        {
          "test": {},
          "use": [
            "source-map-loader"
          ],
          "enforce": "pre"
        }
      ]
    }
  }
}

platforms.webos.webpackConfig.metaTagsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.webos.webpackConfig.metaTags

type object

platforms.windowsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.windows

type object

platforms.windows.BrowserWindowâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.windows.BrowserWindow

type object

Allows you to configure electron wrapper app window

examples

{
  "BrowserWindow": {
    "width": 1310,
    "height": 800,
    "webPreferences": {
      "devTools": true
    }
  }
}

platforms.windows.BrowserWindow.heightâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.windows.BrowserWindow.height

type integer

Default height of electron app

platforms.windows.BrowserWindow.webPreferencesâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.windows.BrowserWindow.webPreferences

type object

Extra web preferences of electron app

examples

{
  "webPreferences": {
    "devTools": true
  }
}

path renative.json/#/platforms.windows.BrowserWindow.width

type integer

platforms.windows.backgroundColorâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.windows.backgroundColor

type string

Defines root view backgroundColor for all platforms in HEX format

examples

{
  "backgroundColor": "#FFFFFF"
}
{
  "backgroundColor": "#222222"
}

    "width": 1310,
    "height": 800,
    "webPreferences": {
      "devTools": true
    }

path renative.json/#/platforms.windows.buildSchemes.[object].deploy.type

type string

platforms.windows.buildSchemes.[object].descriptionâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.windows.buildSchemes.[object].description

type string

General description of your app. This prop will be injected to actual projects where description field is applicable

examples

{
  "description": "This app does awesome things"
}

platforms.windows.buildSchemes.[object].electronConfigâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.windows.buildSchemes.[object].electronConfig

type object

Allows you to configure electron app as per https://www.electron.build/

examples

{
  "electronConfig": {
    "mac": {
      "target": [
        "dmg",
        "mas",
        "mas-dev"
      ],
      "hardenedRuntime": true
    },
    "dmg": {
      "sign": false
    },
    "mas": {
      "type": "distribution",
      "hardenedRuntime": false
    }
  }
}

platforms.windows.buildSchemes.[object].enabledâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.windows.buildSchemes.[object].enabled

type boolean

platforms.windows.buildSchemes.[object].engineâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.windows.buildSchemes.[object].engine

type string

platforms.windows.buildSchemes.[object].entryFileâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.windows.buildSchemes.[object].entryFile

type string

platforms.windows.buildSchemes.[object].excludedPluginsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.windows.buildSchemes.[object].excludedPlugins

type array

Defines an array of all excluded plugins for specific config or buildScheme. only full keys as defined in plugin should be used.

NOTE: excludedPlugins is evaluated after includedPlugins

examples

{
  "excludedPlugins": [
    "*"
  ]
}
{
  "excludedPlugins": [
    "react-native-google-cast",
    "react-navigation-tabs"
  ]
}

platforms.windows.buildSchemes.[object].extâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.windows.buildSchemes.[object].ext

type object

Object ysed to extend your renative with custom props. This allows renative json schema to be validated

examples

{
  "ext": {
    "myCustomRenativeProp": "foo"
  }
}

platforms.windows.buildSchemes.[object].idâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.windows.buildSchemes.[object].id

type string

platforms.windows.buildSchemes.[object].ignoreLogsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.windows.buildSchemes.[object].ignoreLogs

type boolean

platforms.windows.buildSchemes.[object].ignoreWarningsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.windows.buildSchemes.[object].ignoreWarnings

type boolean

platforms.windows.buildSchemes.[object].includedFontsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.windows.buildSchemes.[object].includedFonts

type array

Array of fonts you want to include in specific app or scheme. Should use exact font file (without the extension) located in ./appConfigs/base/fonts or * to mark all

examples

{
  "includedFonts": [
    "*"
  ]
}
{
  "includedFonts": [
    "TimeBurner",
    "Entypo"
  ]
}

platforms.windows.buildSchemes.[object].includedPermissionsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.windows.buildSchemes.[object].includedPermissions

type array

Allows you to include specific permissions by their KEY defined in permissions object

examples

{
  "includedPermissions": [
    "*"
  ]
}
{
  "includedPermissions": [
    "INTERNET",
    "CAMERA",
    "SYSTEM_ALERT_WINDOW",
    "RECORD_AUDIO",
    "RECORD_VIDEO",
    "READ_EXTERNAL_STORAGE",
    "WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE",
    "ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION",
    "ACCESS_COARSE_LOCATION",
    "VIBRATE",
    "ACCESS_NETWORK_STATE",
    "ACCESS_WIFI_STATE",
    "RECEIVE_BOOT_COMPLETED",
    "WRITE_CONTACTS",
    "READ_CONTACTS"
  ]
}

platforms.windows.buildSchemes.[object].includedPluginsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.windows.buildSchemes.[object].includedPlugins

type array

Defines an array of all included plugins for specific config or buildScheme. only full keys as defined in plugin should be used.

NOTE: includedPlugins is evaluated before excludedPlugins

examples

{
  "includedPlugins": [
    "*"
  ]
}
{
  "includedPlugins": [
    "react-native-google-cast",
    "react-navigation-tabs"
  ]
}

platforms.windows.buildSchemes.[object].licenseâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.windows.buildSchemes.[object].license

type string

platforms.windows.buildSchemes.[object].permissionsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.windows.buildSchemes.[object].permissions

type array

DEPRECATED in favor of includedPermissions

platforms.windows.buildSchemes.[object].runtimeâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.windows.buildSchemes.[object].runtime

type object

This object will be automatically injected into ./platfromAssets/renative.runtime.json making it possible to inject the values directly to JS source code

examples

{
  "runtime": {
    "someRuntimeProperty": "foo"
  }
}

platforms.windows.buildSchemes.[object].splashScreenâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.windows.buildSchemes.[object].splashScreen

type boolean

platforms.windows.buildSchemes.[object].timestampAssetsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.windows.buildSchemes.[object].timestampAssets

type boolean

If set to true generated js (bundle.js) files will be timestamped and named (bundle-12345678.js) every new build. This is useful if you want to enforce invalidate cache agains standard CDN cache policies every new build you deploy

examples

{
  "timestampAssets": "true"
}
{
  "timestampAssets": "false"
}

platforms.windows.buildSchemes.[object].titleâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.windows.buildSchemes.[object].title

type string

Title of your app will be used to create title of the binary. ie App title of installed app iOS/Android app or Tab title of the website

examples

{
  "title": "Awesome App"
}

platforms.windows.buildSchemes.[object].versionedAssetsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.windows.buildSchemes.[object].versionedAssets

type boolean

If set to true generated js (bundle.js) files will be timestamped and named (bundle-1.0.0.js) every new version. This is useful if you want to enforce invalidate cache agains standard CDN cache policies every new version you deploy

examples

{
  "versionedAssets": "true"
}
{
  "versionedAssets": "false"
}

platforms.windows.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfigâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.windows.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfig

type object

platforms.windows.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfig.customScriptsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.windows.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfig.customScripts

type array

platforms.windows.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfig.devServerHostâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.windows.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfig.devServerHost

type string

platforms.windows.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfig.extendâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.windows.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfig.extend

type object

Allows you to directly extend/override webpack config of your current platform

examples

{
  "extend": {
    "devtool": "source-map"
  }
}
{
  "extend": {
    "module": {
      "rules": [
        {
          "test": {},
          "use": [
            "source-map-loader"
          ],
          "enforce": "pre"
        }
      ]
    }
  }
}

platforms.windows.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfig.metaTagsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.windows.buildSchemes.[object].webpackConfig.metaTags

type object

platforms.windows.webpackConfig.metaTagsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/platforms.windows.webpackConfig.metaTags

type object

pluginTemplatesâ€‹

path renative.json/#/pluginTemplates

type object

pluginsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/plugins

type object

Define all plugins available in your project. you can then use includedPlugins and excludedPlugins props to define active and inactive plugins per each app config

examples

{
  "plugins": {
    "renative": "source:rnv",
    "react": "source:rnv",
    "react-native-cached-image": "source:rnv",
    "react-native-web-image-loader": "source:rnv",
    "react-native-gesture-handler": {
      "version": "1.0.0"
    }
  }
}

plugins.[object].androidâ€‹

path renative.json/#/plugins.[object].android

type object

plugins.[object].android.AndroidManifestâ€‹

path renative.json/#/plugins.[object].android.AndroidManifest

type object

Allows you to directly manipulate AndroidManifest.xml via json override mechanism

Injects / Overrides values in AndroidManifest.xml file of generated android based project

IMPORTANT: always ensure that your object contains tag and android:name to target correct tag to merge into

examples

{
  "AndroidManifest": {
    "children": [
      {
        "tag": "application",
        "android:name": ".MainApplication",
        "children": [
          {
            "tag": "activity",
            "android:name": "com.ahmedadeltito.photoeditor.PhotoEditorActivity"
          }
        ]
      }
    ]
  }
}
{
  "AndroidManifest": {
    "children": [
      {
        "tag": "application",
        "android:name": ".MainApplication",
        "android:allowBackup": true,
        "android:largeHeap": true,
        "android:usesCleartextTraffic": true,
        "tools:targetApi": 28
      }
    ]
  }
}

plugins.[object].android.afterEvaluateâ€‹

path renative.json/#/plugins.[object].android.afterEvaluate

type array

plugins.[object].android.app/build.gradleâ€‹

path renative.json/#/plugins.[object].android.app/build.gradle

type object

Overrides values in app/build.gradle file of generated android based project

examples

{
  "app/build.gradle": {
    "apply": [
      "plugin: 'io.fabric'"
    ]
  }
}

plugins.[object].android.applyPluginâ€‹

path renative.json/#/plugins.[object].android.applyPlugin

type array

plugins.[object].android.build.gradleâ€‹

path renative.json/#/plugins.[object].android.build.gradle

type object

Overrides values in build.gradle file of generated android based project

examples

{
  "build.gradle": {
    "allprojects": {
      "repositories": {
        "maven { url \"https://dl.bintray.com/onfido/maven\" }": true
      }
    }
  }
}

plugins.[object].android.enabledâ€‹

path renative.json/#/plugins.[object].android.enabled

type boolean

plugins.[object].android.gradle.propertiesâ€‹

path renative.json/#/plugins.[object].android.gradle.properties

type object

Overrides values in gradle.properties file of generated android based project

examples

{
  "gradle.properties": {
    "gradle.properties": {
      "android.debug.obsoleteApi": true,
      "debug.keystore": "debug.keystore",
      "org.gradle.daemon": true,
      "org.gradle.parallel": true,
      "org.gradle.configureondemand": true
    }
  }
}

plugins.[object].android.packageâ€‹

path renative.json/#/plugins.[object].android.package

type string

plugins.[object].android.projectNameâ€‹

path renative.json/#/plugins.[object].android.projectName

type string

path renative.json/#/plugins.[object].android.skipImplementation

type boolean

type object

plugins.[object].androidtvâ€‹

type object

plugins.[object].androidtv.AndroidManifestâ€‹

path renative.json/#/plugins.[object].androidtv.AndroidManifest

type object

Allows you to directly manipulate AndroidManifest.xml via json override mechanism

Injects / Overrides values in AndroidManifest.xml file of generated android based project

IMPORTANT: always ensure that your object contains tag and android:name to target correct tag to merge into

examples

{
  "AndroidManifest": {
    "children": [
      {
        "tag": "application",
        "android:name": ".MainApplication",
        "children": [
          {
            "tag": "activity",
            "android:name": "com.ahmedadeltito.photoeditor.PhotoEditorActivity"
          }
        ]
      }
    ]
  }
}
{
  "AndroidManifest": {
    "children": [
      {
        "tag": "application",
        "android:name": ".MainApplication",
        "android:allowBackup": true,
        "android:largeHeap": true,
        "android:usesCleartextTraffic": true,
        "tools:targetApi": 28
      }
    ]
  }
}

    "apply": [
      "plugin: 'io.fabric'"

plugins.[object].androidwear.AndroidManifestâ€‹

path renative.json/#/plugins.[object].androidwear.AndroidManifest

type object

Allows you to directly manipulate AndroidManifest.xml via json override mechanism

Injects / Overrides values in AndroidManifest.xml file of generated android based project

IMPORTANT: always ensure that your object contains tag and android:name to target correct tag to merge into

examples

{
  "AndroidManifest": {
    "children": [
      {
        "tag": "application",
        "android:name": ".MainApplication",
        "children": [
          {
            "tag": "activity",
            "android:name": "com.ahmedadeltito.photoeditor.PhotoEditorActivity"
          }
        ]
      }
    ]
  }
}
{
  "AndroidManifest": {
    "children": [
      {
        "tag": "application",
        "android:name": ".MainApplication",
        "android:allowBackup": true,
        "android:largeHeap": true,
        "android:usesCleartextTraffic": true,
        "tools:targetApi": 28
      }
    ]
  }
}

plugins.[object].androidwear.afterEvaluateâ€‹

path renative.json/#/plugins.[object].androidwear.afterEvaluate

type array

plugins.[object].androidwear.app/build.gradleâ€‹

path renative.json/#/plugins.[object].androidwear.app/build.gradle

type object

Overrides values in app/build.gradle file of generated android based project

examples

{
  "app/build.gradle": {
    "apply": [
      "plugin: 'io.fabric'"
    ]
  }
}

plugins.[object].androidwear.applyPluginâ€‹

path renative.json/#/plugins.[object].androidwear.applyPlugin

type array

plugins.[object].androidwear.build.gradleâ€‹

path renative.json/#/plugins.[object].androidwear.build.gradle

type object

Overrides values in build.gradle file of generated android based project

examples

{
  "build.gradle": {
    "allprojects": {
      "repositories": {
        "maven { url \"https://dl.bintray.com/onfido/maven\" }": true
      }
    }
  }
}

plugins.[object].androidwear.enabledâ€‹

path renative.json/#/plugins.[object].androidwear.enabled

type boolean

plugins.[object].androidwear.gradle.propertiesâ€‹

path renative.json/#/plugins.[object].androidwear.gradle.properties

type object

Overrides values in gradle.properties file of generated android based project

examples

{
  "gradle.properties": {
    "gradle.properties": {
      "android.debug.obsoleteApi": true,
      "debug.keystore": "debug.keystore",
      "org.gradle.daemon": true,
      "org.gradle.parallel": true,
      "org.gradle.configureondemand": true
    }
  }
}

plugins.[object].androidwear.packageâ€‹

path renative.json/#/plugins.[object].androidwear.package

type string

path renative.json/#/plugins.[object].androidwear.projectName

type string

plugins.[object].androidwear.skipImplementationâ€‹

path renative.json/#/plugins.[object].androidwear.skipImplementation

type boolean

path renative.json/#/plugins.[object].androidwear.webpackConfig

type object

plugins.[object].propsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/plugins.[object].props

type object

plugins.[object].skipMergeâ€‹

path renative.json/#/plugins.[object].skipMerge

type boolean

Will not attempt to merge with existing plugin configuration (ie. coming form renative pluginTemplates)

NOTE: if set to true you need to configure your plugin object fully

examples

{
  "skipMerge": "true"
}
{
  "skipMerge": "false"
}

plugins.[object].sourceâ€‹

path renative.json/#/plugins.[object].source

type string

Will define custom scope for your plugin config to extend from.

NOTE: custom scopes can be defined via paths.pluginTemplates.[CUSTOM_SCOPE].{}

examples

{
  "source": "rnv"
}
{
  "source": "myCustomScope"
}

plugins.[object].tizenâ€‹

path renative.json/#/plugins.[object].webpack

type object

DEPRECATED in favour of webpackConfig

plugins.[object].webpackConfigâ€‹

path renative.json/#/plugins.[object].webpackConfig

type object

Allows you to configure webpack bahaviour per each individual plugin

plugins.[object].webpackConfig.moduleAliasesâ€‹

path renative.json/#/plugins.[object].webpackConfig.moduleAliases

type boolean,object

plugins.[object].webpackConfig.modulePathsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/plugins.[object].webpackConfig.modulePaths

type boolean,object

plugins.[object].windowsâ€‹

path renative.json/#/plugins.[object].windows

type object

plugins.[object].windows.enabledâ€‹

path renative.json/#/plugins.[object].windows.enabled

type boolean

plugins.[object].windows.webpackConfigâ€‹

path renative.json/#/plugins.[object].windows.webpackConfig

type object

privateâ€‹

path renative.json/#/private

type object

Special object which contains private info. this object should be used only in renative.private.json files and never commited to your repository. Private files usually reside in your workspace and are subject to crypto encryption if enabled. RNV will warn you if it finds private key in your regular renative.json file

examples

{
  "private": {
    "myPrivateKy": "6568347563858739"
  }
}

projectNameâ€‹

path renative.json/#/projectName

type string

Name of the project which will be used in workspace as folder name. this will also be used as part of the KEY in crypto env var generator

examples

{
  "projectName": "my-project"
}
{
  "projectName": "myProject"
}

projectTemplatesâ€‹

path renative.json/#/projectTemplates

type object

Custom list of renative templates (NPM package names) which will be displayed during rnv new project bootstrap. This prop usually resides in workspace config.

examples

{
  "projectTemplates": {
    "my-custom-template": {}
  }
}

publishâ€‹

path renative.json/#/publish

type object

runtimeâ€‹

path renative.json/#/runtime

type object

This object will be automatically injected into ./platfromAssets/renative.runtime.json making it possible to inject the values directly to JS source code

examples

{
  "runtime": {
    "someRuntimeProperty": "foo"
  }
}

sdksâ€‹

path renative.json/#/sdks

type object

List of SDK locations used by RNV. This property is usually located in your WORKSPACE/renative.json

examples

{
  "sdks": {
    "ANDROID_SDK": "/Users/paveljacko/Library/Android/sdk",
    "ANDROID_NDK": "/Users/paveljacko/Library/Android/sdk/ndk-bundle",
    "TIZEN_SDK": "/Users/paveljacko/tizen-studio",
    "WEBOS_SDK": "/opt/webOS_TV_SDK",
    "KAIOS_SDK": "/Applications/Kaiosrt.app"
  }
}

tasksâ€‹

path renative.json/#/tasks

type object

Allows to override specific task within renative toolchain. (currently only install supported). this is useful if you want to change specific behaviour of built-in task. ie install task triggers yarn/npm install by default. but that might not be desirable installation trigger

examples

{
  "tasks": {
    "install": {
      "script": "yarn bootstrap"
    }
  }
}

templatesâ€‹

path renative.json/#/templates

type object

Stores installed templates info in your project.

NOTE: This prop will be updated by rnv if you run rnv template install

examples

{
  "templates": {
    "renative-template-hello-world": {
      "version": "0.31.0"
    }
  }
}

versionâ€‹

path renative.json/#/version

type string

Semver style version of your app.

examples

{
  "version": "0.1.0"
}
{
  "version": "1.0.0"
}
{
  "version": "1.0.0-alpha.1"
}
{
  "version": "1.0.0-RC.7"
}
{
  "version": "1.0.0-feature-x.0"
}

versionCodeâ€‹

path renative.json/#/versionCode

type string

Manual verride of generated version code

examples

{
  "versionCode": "1000"
}
{
  "versionCode": "10023"
}

versionCodeFormatâ€‹

path renative.json/#/versionCodeFormat

type string

allows you to fine-tune auto generated version codes

default value: 00.00.00

IN: 1.2.3-rc.4+build.56 OUT: 102030456

IN: 1.2.3 OUT: 10203

"versionCodeFormat" : "00.00.00.00.00"

IN: 1.2.3-rc.4+build.56 OUT: 102030456

IN: 1.2.3 OUT: 102030000

examples

{
  "versionCodeFormat": "00.00.00"
}
{
  "versionCodeFormat": "00.00.00.00.00"
}

workspaceIDâ€‹

path renative.json/#/workspaceID

type string

Workspace ID your project belongs to. This will mach same folder name in the root of your user directory. ie ~/ on macOS

examples

{
  "workspaceID": "rnv"
}
{
  "workspaceID": "myCustomWorkspace"
}
